ProfileMetadata.description: This vocabulary is describing the power system profile.

DifferenceModel.description: A set of statements describing the changes in the network model. The statement is defined in the difference model.

String.description: A string consisting of a sequence of characters. The character encoding is UTF-8. The string length is unspecified and unlimited.

Resource.accessRights.description:
Information about who access the resource or an indication of its security status.
Access Rights may include information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies.

StringIRI.description:
An IRI (Internationalized Resource Identifier) within an RDF graph is a Unicode string that conforms to the syntax defined in RFC 3987.
The primitive is serialized as literal without language support.
IRIs in the RDF abstract syntax must be absolute, and may contain a fragment identifier.
IRI equality: Two IRIs are equal if and only if they are equivalent under Simple String Comparison according to section 5.1 of [RFC3987]. Further normalization must not be performed when comparing IRIs for equality.
IRIs are a generalization of URIs [RFC3986] that permits a wider range of Unicode characters. Every absolute URI and URL is an IRI, but not every IRI is an URI. When IRIs are used in operations that are only defined for URIs, they must first be converted according to the mapping defined in section 3.1 of [RFC3987]. A notable example is retrieval over the HTTP protocol. The mapping involves UTF-8 encoding of non-ASCII characters, %-encoding of octets not allowed in URIs, and Punycode-encoding of domain names.

Resource.conformsTo.description: An established standard to which the described resource conforms.

Resource.creator.description:
An entity responsible for making the resource.
Recommended practice is to identify the creator with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value that identifies the creator may be provided.

Resource.description.description:
A free-text account of the resource.
Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, a table of contents, a graphical representation, or a free-text account of the resource.

Resource.identifier.description:
A unique identifier of the resource being described or cataloged.
The identifier might be used as part of the IRI of the resource, but still having it represented explicitly is useful.
The identifier is a text string which is assigned to the resource to provide an unambiguous reference within a particular context.

DateTime.description: Date and time as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sss", which conforms with ISO 8601. UTC time zone is specified as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ". A local timezone relative UTC is specified as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sss-hh:mm". The second component (shown here as "ss.sss") could have any number of digits in its fractional part to allow any kind of precision beyond seconds.

Resource.issued.description:
Date of formal issuance of the resource.
Recommended practice is to describe the date, date/time, or period of time as recommended for the property Date, of which this is a subproperty.

Resource.license.description:
A legal document under which the resource is made available.
Recommended practice is to identify the license document with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value that identifies the license may be provided.

Date.description: Date as "yyyy-mm-dd", which conforms with ISO 8601. UTC time zone is specified as "yyyy-mm-ddZ". A local timezone relative UTC is specified as "yyyy-mm-dd(+/-)hh:mm".

Resource.modified.description:
Most recent date on which the item was changed, updated or modified.
Recommended practice is to describe the date, date/time, or period of time as recommended for the property Date, of which this is a subproperty.

Resource.publisher.description: An entity responsible for making the resource available.

Resource.rights.description: A statement that concerns all rights not addressed with dct:license or dct:accessRights, such as copyright statements.

Resource.rightsHolder.description:
Information about rights held in and over the resource.
Typically, rights information includes a statement about various property rights associated with the resource, including intellectual property rights. Recommended practice is to refer to a rights statement with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value (name, label, or short text) may be provided.

Resource.title.description: A name given to the resource.

Resource.versionNotes.description: A description of changes between this version and the previous version of the resource.

IRI.description:
An IRI (Internationalized Resource Identifier) within an RDF graph is a Unicode string that conforms to the syntax defined in RFC 3987.
The primitive is serialized as rdf:resource in RDFXML.
IRIs in the RDF abstract syntax must be absolute, and may contain a fragment identifier.
IRI equality: Two IRIs are equal if and only if they are equivalent under Simple String Comparison according to section 5.1 of [RFC3987]. Further normalization must not be performed when comparing IRIs for equality.
IRIs are a generalization of URIs [RFC3986] that permits a wider range of Unicode characters. Every absolute URI and URL is an IRI, but not every IRI is an URI. When IRIs are used in operations that are only defined for URIs, they must first be converted according to the mapping defined in section 3.1 of [RFC3987]. A notable example is retrieval over the HTTP protocol. The mapping involves UTF-8 encoding of non-ASCII characters, %-encoding of octets not allowed in URIs, and Punycode-encoding of domain names.

Resource.hasVersion.description: This resource has a more specific, versioned resource.

Resource.isVersionOf.description:
A related resource of which the described resource is a version, edition, or adaptation.
Changes in version imply substantive changes in content rather than differences in format. This property is intended to be used with non-literal values. This property is an inverse property of hasVersion.

StringFixedLanguage.description:
A string consisting of a sequence of characters. The character encoding is UTF-8. The string length is unspecified and unlimited.
The primitive is serialized as literal without language support.

Resource.keyword.description: A keyword or tag describing a resource.

Resource.version.description: The version indicator (name or identifier) of a resource.

PowerSystemProject.description: Knowledge data for the power system project that describe the status and the planned implementation of the changes into the as-built model.

PowerSystemProject.AvailabilitySchedule.description: The availability schedule associated with this power system project.

PowerSystemProject.DependentOnProject.description: Grouping of projects that are depending on each other. A project can only be linked to one dependent project.

PowerSystemProject.DifferenceModel.description: The difference model describing this power system project.

PowerSystemProject.PriorityProject.description: The project that has an alternative project.

PowerSystemProject.ProjectGroup.description: Power system project group to which this project belongs.

PowerSystemProject.ShadowProject.description: A shadowing project that includes the same change set, but different timeline.

PowerSystemProject.cancelled.description: From this date the project is in cancelled state. No further development will be done to the project or associated change set in this state.

PowerSystemProject.commissioned.description: From this date the project is in commissioned state. Any conducting equipment in the change set can be energized from this day. No further changes will be done to the change set.

PowerSystemProject.committed.description: From this date the project is in committed state. The change set will from this day be part of the as-build model.

PowerSystemProject.inBuild.description: From this day the project is in build state. Alternative project have been evaluated. Any procurement has started and the change set is being updated to an as-build model.

PowerSystemProject.inPlan.description: From this date the project is in planning state. Study or procurement strategy has triggered the start of a project involving changes to one or more models. Alternative projects and change sets are evaluated.

Integer.description: An integer number. The range is unspecified and not limited.

PowerSystemProject.priority.description: Priority between competing project. Use 0 for do not care. Use 1 for highest priority. Use 2 as priority is less than 1 and so on.

PowerSystemProjectGroup.description: A container with project that are grouped together. Primarily used for navigation and to highlight the phases that an overall project can go though.

PowerSystemProjectGroup.description.description:
A free-text account of the resource.
Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, a table of contents, a graphical representation, or a free-text account of the resource.

PowerSystemProjectGroup.identifier.description:
A unique identifier of the resource being described or cataloged.
The identifier might be used as part of the IRI of the resource, but still having it represented explicitly is useful.
The identifier is a text string which is assigned to the resource to provide an unambiguous reference within a particular context.

PowerSystemProjectGroup.title.description: A name given to the resource.

Dataset.description: A collection of data, published or curated by a single source, and available for access or download in one or more representations.

URI.description: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) or URI Reference as defined by [RFC 3986], including amendments from [RFC 6874] for IPv6 zone identifiers. The value may be absolute or relative and can include an optional fragment identifier. This datatype is used to indicate that the value fulfills the role of a URI or URI Reference, providing a consistent format for referencing abstract or physical resources.

accessRights.description:
Information about who access the resource or an indication of its security status. Access Rights may include information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies.
[CIM context:
Reference to the confidentiality level that shall be applied when handling this model.].

accrualPeriodicity.description:
The frequency with which items are added to a collection.
[CIM context:
Reference to the time frame.].

conformsTo.description:
An established standard to which the described resource conforms.
[CIM context:
An IRI describing the profile that governs this model. It uniquely identifies the profile and its version. Multiple instances of the property describe all standards or specifications to which the model and the document representing this model conform to.
A document would normally conform to profile definitions, the constraints that relate to the profile and/or the set of business specific constrains. A reference to a machine- readable constraints or specification indicates that the document was tested against these constraints and it conforms to them.].

LangString.description: Datatype that conforms to rdf:langString, representing a textual value with an associated language tag, following BCP 47 language conventions (e.g., en, fr-CA, no-NB).

description.description:
A free-text account of the resource.
Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, a table of contents, a graphical representation, or a free-text account of the resource.

hasPart.description: The dataset which is part of another dataset.

UUID.description: Datatype representing a unique identifier in the form of a universally unique identifier (UUID). The value must conform to the UUID format as defined in RFC 4122, allowing for globally unique identification of entities.

identifier.description:
A unique identifier of the resource being described or cataloged.
The identifier might be used as part of the IRI of the resource, but still having it represented explicitly is useful.
The identifier is a text string which is assigned to the resource to provide an unambiguous reference within a particular context.
[CIM context:
A unique identifier of the model which is serialised in the document where the header is located. The identifier is persistent for a given version of the model and shall change when the model changes.
If a model is serialized as complete (full) model or as difference model exchange the identifier shall be the same. The identifier shall not be used as an identifier of the document which can be different for a given version of a model.].

issued.description:
Date of formal issuance of the resource.
Recommended practice is to describe the date, date/time, or period of time as recommended for the property Date, of which this is a subproperty.
[CIM context:
Reference to the date that the complete data set was made valid/available.].

license.description:
A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource. Recommended practice is to identify the license document with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value that identifies the license may be provided.
[CIM context:
Reference to the license under which the data is made available. If no license holder is defined, then the original data provider holds the license.].

publisher.description:
An entity responsible for making the resource available.
[CIM context: 
The agent that is publishing the dataset on the given platform.]

references.description:
A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise pointed to by the described resource[.
[CIM context: 
The referenced resource that is being complemented in this dataset, e.g. SSH is referencing EQ.]

replaces.description:
A related resource that is supplanted, displaced, or superseded by the described resource
[CIM context: 
The referenced dataset is being replaced by this dataset.]

requires.description: A related resource that is required by the described resource to support its function, delivery, or coherence.

rights.description: A statement that concerns all rights not addressed with dct:license or dct:accessRights, such as copyright statements.

rightsHolder.description:
Information about rights held in and over the resource.
Typically, rights information includes a statement about various property rights associated with the resource, including intellectual property rights. Recommended practice is to refer to a rights statement with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value (name, label, or short text) may be provided.

source.description:
A related resource from which the described resource is derived.
This property is intended to be used with non-literal values. The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a URI or a string conforming to a formal identification system.

spatial.description:
The geographical area covered by the dataset.
[CIM context: 
The responsibility area that multiple model can describe, also referred to frame.].

title.description: A name given to the resource.

type.description: The nature or genre of the resource. Recommended practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the DCMI Type Vocabulary [DCMI-TYPE]. To describe the file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource, use the property Format.

versionNotes.description: A description of changes between this version and the previous version of the resource.

DateTimeStamp.description: Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:dateTimeStamp, in which the time-zone field is mandatory.

endDate.description:
This property contains the end of the period.
[CIM context:
The end date and time of the validity period of the model that it is serialized in the document where the header is located. It is only used in relation to the startDate property which indicates the beginning of the validity period of the model.].

inSeries.description: A dataset series of which the dataset is part.

isVersionOf.description:
This resource has a more specific, versioned resource. This property is intended for relating a non-versioned or abstract resource to several versioned resources, e.g., snapshots.

The notion of version used by this property is limited to versions resulting from revisions occurring to a resource as part of its life-cycle. Therefore, its semantics is more specific than its super-property dcterms:hasVersion, which makes use of a broader notion of version, including editions and adaptations.

keyword.description:
A keyword or tag describing a resource.
[CIM context:
The intended content type of the model, usually the profile keyword. Used to identify what profiles and content is expected in the document, e.g., Equipment, Boundary, SSH, AE, etc. The same keyword is used for different versions of same profile. It can be also used to identify different content based on the same profile.
For instance, as the equipment profile can be used for both boundary data and equipment not related to boundary, the keyword is different to indicate that boundary data is exchanged. In order to avoid ambiguity the property is not exchanged in cases where the document contains multiple profiles referenced by dcterms:conformsTo.].

nextVersion.description: The next version for the resource.

previousVersion.description:
The previous version of a resource in a lineage.
This property is meant to be used to specify a version chain, consisting of snapshots of a resource.

The notion of version used by this property is limited to versions resulting from revisions occurring to a resource as part of its life-cycle. One of the typical cases here is representing the history of the versions of a dataset that have been released over time.

startDate.description:
This property contains the start of the period.
[CIM context:
The date and time that this model represents, i.e. for which the model is (or was) valid. It indicates the beginning of the validity period. It is indicating either an instant (in cases where the model is only valid for a point in time) or the start time of a period. If not provided the model is considered valid for any time stamp. The format is an extended format according to the ISO 8601-2005. European exchanges shall refer to UTC.].

Duration.description: Duration as "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS" which conforms to ISO 8601, where nY expresses a number of years, nM a number of months, nD a number of days. The letter T separates the date expression from the time expression and, after it, nH identifies a number of hours, nM a number of minutes and nS a number of seconds. The number of seconds could be expressed as a decimal number, but all other numbers are integers.

temporalResolution.description:
Minimum time period resolvable in a dataset.
[CIM context: 
Describes the Market Time Unit (MTU), e.g. hourly, 15 min., etc.]

Version.description: Datatype representing a version identifier that follows Semantic Versioning (SemVer 2.0.0) principles: MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH[-PRERELEASE][+BUILD]. The version consists of a sequence of numbers and optional alphanumeric identifiers that indicate changes in a system, model, or software over time.

version.description: The version indicator (name or identifier) of a resource.

generatedAtTime.description:
Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.
[CIM context:
The date and time when the model was serialized in the document where the header is located. The format is an extended format according to the ISO 8601-2005. European exchanges shall refer to UTC.].

wasGeneratedBy.description:
Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.
[CIM context:
Reference to an activity or the exact business nature (process, configuration) which produced or uses the model.].

applicationSoftware.description:
Identifies the application software which generated this instance file. The application software term is defined in ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017. The application software can be identified either:
- as a string which contains information on the software name and version, e.g. <tool_name>-<major_version>.<minor_version>.<patch>, or
- as a reference to a software identification tag as defined by ISO/IEC 19770-2:2015 and ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017.

processType.description: The exact business nature. Reference to Business Process configurations.

usedSettings.description: Reference to a set of parameters describing used settings (e.g. power flow settings, process settings, etc.) applied to the model prior its serialisation.

alternativeVersionOf.description:
This resource is an alternative version of a non-versioned or abstract resource.
This property is intended for relating a versioned resource to a non-versioned or abstract resource at the same time express that multiple versions exist.
dcatcim:alternativeVersionOf is a specialisation of dcat:isVersionOf with the restriction that the resource shall have a preferred version (dcatcim:preferredVersion) so that the preferred dataset can be used when there is no need to access all alternative versions.

preferredVersion.description:
The preferred version of a resource in a lineage of alternative versions.
This property is used to specify a specific version to be the preference in a chain of alternatives, consisting of snapshots of a resource.

DifferenceSet.description: A dataset that is represented by statement that describe the difference previous version by using forwardDifference Statement for item that is added and reverseDifference Statement for items that are removed. Items that are updated is described in both the forwardDifference and reversalDifference statements.

Statements.description: One or more facts in the form of an RDF triples that forms a cohesive description of change to a dataset.

forwardDifference.description: Statement that describes facts that has been added from previous version of the dataset.

reverseDifference.description: Statement that describes facts that has been removed from previous version of the dataset.

Statement.description: rdf:Statement is an instance of rdfs:Class. It is intended to represent the class of RDF statements. An RDF statement is the statement made by a token of an RDF triple. The subject of an RDF statement is the instance of rdfs:Resource identified by the subject of the triple. The predicate of an RDF statement is the instance of rdf:Property identified by the predicate of the triple. The object of an RDF statement is the instance of rdfs:Resource identified by the object of the triple. rdf:Statement is in the domain of the properties rdf:predicate, rdf:subject and rdf:object. Different individual rdf:Statement instances may have the same values for their rdf:predicate, rdf:subject and rdf:object properties.

statement.description: A name given to the resource.

ProfileMetadata.description: This vocabulary is describing the object registry profile.
ProfileMetadata.title: ObjectRegistry-AP-Voc-RDFS2020_v2-2-5.rdf
ProfileMetadata.comment: This package contains the equipment object registry profile.
ProfileMetadata.label: ObjectRegistryProfile

IdentifiedObject.description: This is a root class to provide common identification for all classes needing identification and naming attributes.

String.description: A string consisting of a sequence of characters. The character encoding is UTF-8. The string length is unspecified and unlimited.

IdentifiedObject.aliasName.description:
The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

IdentifiedObject.description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

IdentifiedObject.energyIdentCodeEic.description: The attribute is used for an exchange of the EIC code (Energy identification Code). The length of the string is 16 characters as defined by the EIC code. For details on EIC scheme please refer to ENTSO-E web site.

IdentifiedObject.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

IdentifiedObject.name.description: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

IdentifiedObject.shortName.description: The attribute is used for an exchange of a human readable short name with length of the string 12 characters maximum.

IdentifiedObject.ObjectType.description: The object type of the IdentifiedObject.

Name.description: The Name class provides the means to define any number of human readable names for an object. A name is not to be used for defining inter-object relationships. For inter-object relationships instead use the object identification 'mRID'.

Name.name.description: Any free text that used as a name or alternative identifier of the object.

Name.IdentifiedObject.description: Identified object that this name designates.

Name.NamingAuthority.description: Authority responsible for managing this name.

Name.UniqueIdentifiedObject.description: Identified object that this alternative identifier designates.

Name.language.description:
Shall be specified as an IETF BCP 47 language tag (e.g. en-US).  Applies to the Name.name attribute. 
IETF language tags combine subtags from other standards such as ISO 639, ISO 15924, ISO 3166-1, and UN M.49. The tag structure has been standardized by the IETF in Best Current Practice (BCP) 47; the subtags are maintained by the IANA Language Subtag Registry.

Name.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

NameType.description:
Type of name. Possible values for attribute 'name' are implementation dependent but standard profiles may specify types. An enterprise may have multiple IT systems each having its own local name for the same object, e.g. a planning system may have different names from an EMS. An object may also have different names within the same IT system, e.g. localName as defined in CIM version 14. The definition from CIM14 is:
The localName is a human readable name of the object. It is a free text name local to a node in a naming hierarchy similar to a file directory structure. A power system related naming hierarchy may be: Substation, VoltageLevel, Equipment etc. Children of the same parent in such a hierarchy have names that typically are unique among them.

NameType.NamingAuthority.description: Authority responsible for managing this name type.

NameType.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

NamingAuthority.description: Authority responsible for creation and management of names of a given name type and/or name; typically an organization or an enterprise system.

NamingAuthority.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

ObjectType.description: Identifies the specialised type of an object when the instance object is serialised using a generalised class. It may be useful when the object type is not otherwise included in the exchange. For example, a Meter may be serialised as an EndDevice in message exchanges and need to have the ObjectType.type be specified as 'Meter' to provide context to the message receiver.

ObjectType.type.description: The specialised type of an object when the instance object is serialised using a generalised class. For example, a Meter being serialised as an EndDevice in a message exchange should have the type attribute specified as 'Meter'.

Dataset.description: A collection of data, published or curated by a single source, and available for access or download in one or more representations.

The geographical area covered by the dataset.
[CIM context: 
The responsibility area that multiple model can describe, also referred to frame.].

title.description: A name given to the resource.

type.description: The nature or genre of the resource. Recommended practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the DCMI Type Vocabulary [DCMI-TYPE]. To describe the file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource, use the property Format.

versionNotes.description: A description of changes between this version and the previous version of the resource.

DateTimeStamp.description: Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:dateTimeStamp, in which the time-zone field is mandatory.

endDate.description:
This property contains the end of the period.
[CIM context:
The end date and time of the validity period of the model that it is serialized in the document where the header is located. It is only used in relation to the startDate property which indicates the beginning of the validity period of the model.].

inSeries.description: A dataset series of which the dataset is part.

isVersionOf.description:
This resource has a more specific, versioned resource. This property is intended for relating a non-versioned or abstract resource to several versioned resources, e.g., snapshots.

The notion of version used by this property is limited to versions resulting from revisions occurring to a resource as part of its life-cycle. Therefore, its semantics is more specific than its super-property dcterms:hasVersion, which makes use of a broader notion of version, including editions and adaptations.

keyword.description:
A keyword or tag describing a resource.
[CIM context:
The intended content type of the model, usually the profile keyword. Used to identify what profiles and content is expected in the document, e.g., Equipment, Boundary, SSH, AE, etc. The same keyword is used for different versions of same profile. It can be also used to identify different content based on the same profile.
For instance, as the equipment profile can be used for both boundary data and equipment not related to boundary, the keyword is different to indicate that boundary data is exchanged. In order to avoid ambiguity the property is not exchanged in cases where the document contains multiple profiles referenced by dcterms:conformsTo.].

nextVersion.description: The next version for the resource.

previousVersion.description:
The previous version of a resource in a lineage.
This property is meant to be used to specify a version chain, consisting of snapshots of a resource.

The notion of version used by this property is limited to versions resulting from revisions occurring to a resource as part of its life-cycle. One of the typical cases here is representing the history of the versions of a dataset that have been released over time.

startDate.description:
This property contains the start of the period.
[CIM context:
The date and time that this model represents, i.e. for which the model is (or was) valid. It indicates the beginning of the validity period. It is indicating either an instant (in cases where the model is only valid for a point in time) or the start time of a period. If not provided the model is considered valid for any time stamp. The format is an extended format according to the ISO 8601-2005. European exchanges shall refer to UTC.].

Duration.description: Duration as "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS" which conforms to ISO 8601, where nY expresses a number of years, nM a number of months, nD a number of days. The letter T separates the date expression from the time expression and, after it, nH identifies a number of hours, nM a number of minutes and nS a number of seconds. The number of seconds could be expressed as a decimal number, but all other numbers are integers.

temporalResolution.description:
Minimum time period resolvable in a dataset.
[CIM context: 
Describes the Market Time Unit (MTU), e.g. hourly, 15 min., etc.]

Version.description: Datatype representing a version identifier that follows Semantic Versioning (SemVer 2.0.0) principles: MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH[-PRERELEASE][+BUILD]. The version consists of a sequence of numbers and optional alphanumeric identifiers that indicate changes in a system, model, or software over time.

version.description: The version indicator (name or identifier) of a resource.

generatedAtTime.description:
Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.
[CIM context:
The date and time when the model was serialized in the document where the header is located. The format is an extended format according to the ISO 8601-2005. European exchanges shall refer to UTC.].

wasGeneratedBy.description:
Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.
[CIM context:
Reference to an activity or the exact business nature (process, configuration) which produced or uses the model.].

applicationSoftware.description:
Identifies the application software which generated this instance file. The application software term is defined in ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017. The application software can be identified either:
- as a string which contains information on the software name and version, e.g. <tool_name>-<major_version>.<minor_version>.<patch>, or
- as a reference to a software identification tag as defined by ISO/IEC 19770-2:2015 and ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017.

processType.description: The exact business nature. Reference to Business Process configurations.

usedSettings.description: Reference to a set of parameters describing used settings (e.g. power flow settings, process settings, etc.) applied to the model prior its serialisation.

alternativeVersionOf.description:
This resource is an alternative version of a non-versioned or abstract resource.
This property is intended for relating a versioned resource to a non-versioned or abstract resource at the same time express that multiple versions exist.
dcatcim:alternativeVersionOf is a specialisation of dcat:isVersionOf with the restriction that the resource shall have a preferred version (dcatcim:preferredVersion) so that the preferred dataset can be used when there is no need to access all alternative versions.

preferredVersion.description:
The preferred version of a resource in a lineage of alternative versions.
This property is used to specify a specific version to be the preference in a chain of alternatives, consisting of snapshots of a resource.

DifferenceSet.description: A dataset that is represented by statement that describe the difference previous version by using forwardDifference Statement for item that is added and reverseDifference Statement for items that are removed. Items that are updated is described in both the forwardDifference and reversalDifference statements.

Statements.description: One or more facts in the form of an RDF triples that forms a cohesive description of change to a dataset.

forwardDifference.description: Statement that describes facts that has been added from previous version of the dataset.

reverseDifference.description: Statement that describes facts that has been removed from previous version of the dataset.

Statement.description: rdf:Statement is an instance of rdfs:Class. It is intended to represent the class of RDF statements. An RDF statement is the statement made by a token of an RDF triple. The subject of an RDF statement is the instance of rdfs:Resource identified by the subject of the triple. The predicate of an RDF statement is the instance of rdf:Property identified by the predicate of the triple. The object of an RDF statement is the instance of rdfs:Resource identified by the object of the triple. rdf:Statement is in the domain of the properties rdf:predicate, rdf:subject and rdf:object. Different individual rdf:Statement instances may have the same values for their rdf:predicate, rdf:subject and rdf:object properties.

statement.description: A name given to the resource.

ProfileMetadata.creator: ENTSO-E CIM WG NC project
ProfileMetadata.description: This vocabulary is describing the remedial action profile.
ProfileMetadata.title: RemedialAction-AP-Voc-RDFS2020_v2-4-0.rdf
ProfileMetadata.comment: This package contains remedial action profile.
ProfileMetadata.label: RemedialActionProfile

ACDCConverterAction.description: Alternate current Direct current (ACDC) converter action.

String.description: A string consisting of a sequence of characters. The character encoding is UTF-8. The string length is unspecified and unlimited.

IdentifiedObject.description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

IdentifiedObject.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

IdentifiedObject.name.description: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

ACDCConverterAction.ACDCConverter.description: The ACDCConverter that is associated with an action.

GridStateAlteration.GridStateAlterationC.description: The collection that has a GridStateAlteration.

GridStateAlteration.GridStateAlterationR.description: The grid state alteration remedial action associated with a given grid state alteration.

GridStateAlteration.PropertyReference.description: The property reference for this grid state alteration.

Integer.description: An integer number. The range is unspecified and not limited.

GridStateAlteration.maximumPerDay.description: Maximum number of alterations per day.

Duration.description: Duration as "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS" which conforms to ISO 8601, where nY expresses a number of years, nM a number of months, nD a number of days. The letter T separates the date expression from the time expression and, after it, nH identifies a number of hours, nM a number of minutes and nS a number of seconds. The number of seconds could be expressed as a decimal number, but all other numbers are integers.

GridStateAlteration.minimumActivation.description: Minimum time duration between activating the same grid state alteration.

Boolean.description: A type with the value space "true" and "false".

GridStateAlteration.normalEnabled.description: The default/normal value used when other active signal/values are missing.

GridStateAlteration.timePerStage.description: Time to implement a stage of a grid state alteration. If a grid state alteration consists of multiple stages (e.g. A step on a power transformer), this duration comes in addition to the timeToImplement and need to be multiplied by the number of stages. A stage can also be defined as MW in the case of regulating production.

AvailabilityRemedialAction.description: Availability remedial action is a remedial action that cancels or reschedules an availability schedule.

RemedialAction.AppointedToRegion.description: The region in which the remedial action is appointed.

PerCent.description: Percentage on a defined base.   For example, specify as 100 to indicate at the defined base.

RemedialAction.impactThresholdMargin.description:
Impact threshold margin for the use of the remedial action. Meaning that the remedial action should not be used if it cannot resolve violation with more than the given impact threshold margin.
The allowed value range is [0,100].

RemedialAction.isCrossBorderRelevant.description: Indicates if the remedial action is cross border relevant.  True, means that the remedial action is cross border relevant.

RemedialAction.isManual.description: Indicates if the remedial action is manually executed which involves one or many actions performed by human. A SIPS remedial action cannot be manual.  True, means that the remedial action is manual. False, means that the remedial action is automatically executed without human communication.

RemedialActionKind.curative.description: Curative remedial action means a remedial action that is the result of an operational planning process and is activated straight subsequent to the occurrence of the respective contingency for compliance with the (N-1) criterion, taking into account transitory admissible overloads and their accepted duration.

RemedialActionKind.preventive.description: Preventive remedial action means a remedial action that is the result of an operational planning process and needs to be activated prior to the investigated timeframe for compliance with the (N-1) criterion.

RemedialAction.kind.description:
The kind of the remedial action. If curative remedial action, it is required to have an association with ContingencyWithRemedialAction.
If preventive remedial action, RemedialAction class shall not have association with ContingencyWithRemedialAction.

RemedialAction.normalAvailable.description: Identifies if the remedial action can be used in further processes under normal condition. True means available, False means unavailable. For instance, remedial action optimisation and coordination.

Float.description: A floating point number. The range is unspecified and not limited.

RemedialAction.penaltyFactor.description: Defines the relative penalty for a given remedial action. This is a positive number greater than zero and default is one, meaning the remedial action does not have negative nor positive effect on the quality of the solution. A remedial action that provide changes in the transmission loss can have negative (Between zero and one) or positive effect (Bigger than one) given by 1 / (1 – Incremental Transmission Loss). In a similar way remedial action using generating units or compensation units can have negative or positive effect. Typical value would be between 0.8 and 1.1.

RemedialAction.timeToImplement.description: Time to implement a remedial action.

BatteryUnitAction.BatteryUnit.description: The BatteryUnit that is associated with an action.

BiddingZoneAction.BiddingZone.description: The bidding zone that has this bidding zone action.

ContingencyWithRemedialAction.description: Combination of a contingency and a remedial action. ContingencyWithRemedialAction shall not be instantiated for preventive RemedialAction (RemedialAction.kind equals RemedialActionKind.preventive).

ContingencyWithRemedialAction.Contingenc.description: The contingency that is associated with a remedial action, i.e. the contingency that is the cause for the creation of a remedial action and justifies it or would usually be resolved with a remedial action.

ContingencyWithRemedialAction.RemedialAc.description: The remedial action defined for this contingency and remedial action combination.

ContingencyWithRemedialAction.combinatio.description: Defines the combination constraint of the Contingency and Remedial Action. If included, this remedial action can only be applied for this contingency. Else if excluded, this remedial action should not be used for this contingency. Else if considered, this remedial action can be considered for this contingency.

ContingencyWithRemedialAction.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

ContingencyWithRemedialAction.normalEnab.description: If true, the contingency with remedial action is enabled, otherwise it is disabled under normal operating conditions.

ControlFunctionBlockAction.description: Action for setting the control function block target values.

ControlFunctionBlockAction.ControlFuncti.description: The control function block that is associated with a ControlFunctionBlockAction.

CountertradeRemedialAction.description: Countertrade is a remedial action to relieve physical congestions where the location of activated resources within the bidding zone is not known.

CountertradeRemedialAction.maxEconomicPM.description:
High economic active power limit given by the percentage of the relevant units operating p.   e.g. If a generating unit (G1) with maximum operating active power of 100 MW and a conform load with active maximum load of 50 MW (L1). Max economic p margin of 90% will give the limit of the shift key to be 90 MW for the G1 and 45 MW for the L1.
The allowed value range is [0,100].

CountertradeRemedialAction.minEconomicPM.description:
Low economic active power limit given by the percentage of the relevant units operating p.   e.g. If a generating unit (G1) with minimum operating active power of 10 MW and a conform load with active maximum load of 5 MW (L1). Min economic p margin of 90%  will give the limit of the shift key to be 11 MW for the G1 and 5.5 MW for the L1.
The allowed value range is [0,100].

PowerRemedialAction.BiddingZone.description: The Bidding Zone where the power remedial action is done.

PowerRemedialAction.BiddingZoneBorder.description: Bidding zone border where the power remedial action is done.

EnergySourceModification.EnergySource.description: The EnergySource which is associated with an EnergySourceAction.

EquipmentControllerAction.description: Action for setting the equipment controller action.

EquipmentControllerAction.EquipmentContr.description: Equipment controller that has associated equipment controller actions.

EquivalentInjectionAction.EquivalentInje.description: The EquivalentInjection that is associated with an action.

ExternalNetworkInjectionAction.ExternalN.description: The ExternalNetworkInjection that is associated with an action.

Gate.description: Logical gate that supports a logical operation based on the input.

GateLogicKind.and.description: A logical AND operation. True when all inputs are true.

GateLogicKind.nand.description: A logical NAND operation. False when all inputs are true.

GateLogicKind.nor.description: A logical NOR operation. False when one or more inputs are true.

GateLogicKind.not.description: A logical NOT operation. Only one input and true input will give false out and false in will give true out. An inverter.

GateLogicKind.or.description: A logical OR operation. True when one or more inputs are true.

GateLogicKind.xnor.description: A logical XNOR operation. The function is the inverse of the exclusive OR (XOR) gate. All input false or true will give true. Otherwise false.

GateLogicKind.xor.description: A logical XOR operation.  All input false or true will give false. Otherwise true.

Gate.kind.description: The logical operation of the gate.

GridStateAlterationCollection.description: A collection of grid state alterations.

GridStateAlterationRemedialAction.description: Grid state alteration remedial action describes one or many grid state alterations applied to a grid model state or a particular scenario in order to resolve one or more identified constraints.

GridStateAlterationRemedialAction.isActi.description: If true, all GridStateAlterations associated with the GridStateAlterationRemedialAction need to be available in order to activate the RA. If false, it means that even if one or more GridStateAlterations is/are not available then the rest of the GridStateAlterationRemedialAction can be activated. Being available means it is not in a contingency or out or service. A switch that has an action of opening is still available if it is open. GridStateAlteration.normalEnabled or GridStateAlteration.enabled equal to false does not make the GridStateAlterationRemedialAction not available even if GridStateAlteration as part of the remedial action cannot be used in a GridStateAlterationRemedialAction.

InServiceAction.description: In service action represents a change of the status of the equipment in the grid model compared to the base case.

InServiceAction.Equipment.description: Equipment that has a in service action associated.

IntertemporalPropertyRange.description:
It represents the intertemporal range, which means that this is the maximum change of an attribute value between two time stamps or per time unit (e.g. hour). Both up and down directions are defined by the direction attribute, i.e. There are different schedules per direction. 
The class is not instantiated for PropertyReference which refers to Boolean type attributes. 
For instance the following example illustrates the approach:
- A tap changer related grid state alteration having two intertemporal range schedules.
-   For a particular point in time, the value from up schedule is 6 and the value from down schedule is 3.
- Then, the GridStateIntensity for the same point in time cannot be more than plus 6 taps from the current, or more than minus 3 taps from the current.

RangeConstraint.GridStateAlteration.description: The grid state alteration which has static range.

RelativeDirectionKind.down.description: Down signifies that the changes are decreasing from the current status.

RelativeDirectionKind.none.description: There is no direction on the changes.

RelativeDirectionKind.up.description: Up signifies that the changes are increasing from the current status.

RelativeDirectionKind.upAndDown.description: Up and down signifies that both up and down values are equal.

RangeConstraint.direction.description: Defines the direction of the attribute value referenced by the PropertyReference.

RangeConstraint.normalValue.description:
The normal (initial) value. The meaning of the value is defined by the attribute referenced by the PropertyReference. The attribute value can be integer, float or boolean. In case of boolean 1 equals true and 0 equals false.
If the valueKind is incremental or incrementalPercentage, then the attribute value shall be positive (greater than zero).
If the valueKind is absolute, it does not constraint attribute value to be positive.
If the valueKind is incrementalPercentage, then the attribute value “100” shall represent 100%. However, the attribute value can be greater than 100 but not negative.

ValueOffsetKind.absolute.description: Value of the range constraint is replacing the attribute value referenced by the PropertyReference in a determined operational scenario.

ValueOffsetKind.incremental.description: Value of the range constraint is incrementing the attribute value referenced by the PropertyReference in a determined operational scenario.

ValueOffsetKind.incrementalPercentage.description: Value of the range constraint is incrementing in percentage the attribute value referenced by the PropertyReference in a determined operational scenario.

RangeConstraint.valueKind.description: Kind of value offset for the range that applies to the attribute referenced by the PropertyReference.

LoadAction.EnergyConsumer.description: The EnergyConsumer that is associated with a load action.

MeasurementCalculator.description: Result of a calculation of one or more measurement.

CalculationKind.division.description: Division operation on the input values (operands).

CalculationKind.multiplication.description: Multiplication operation on the input values (operands).

CalculationKind.squareRoot.description: Square root operator - only one input value (operands).

CalculationKind.summation.description: Summation operation on the input values (operands).

MeasurementCalculator.kind.description: Calculation operation executed on the operands.

MeasurementCalculatorInput.description: Input to measurement calculation. It supports Analog, Discrete and Accumulator measurements.

MeasurementCalculatorInput.Measurement.description: Measurement used as input to a calculation.

MeasurementCalculatorInput.MeasurementCa.description: The measurement calculator using this calculator input.

MeasurementCalculatorInput.absoluteValue.description: Indicates if the absolute value is used for comparison. If true, use the absolute value. If false, use the complex value (vector).

MeasurementCalculatorInput.order.description: Positive number that defines the order of the operand in the calculation. 0 means default in which case the order is not relevant.

PTCActivePowerSupport.description: Defines the active power capability (support) of the scheme in relation to a PowerTransferCorridor.

PTCActivePowerSupport.PowerTransferCorri.description: The PowerTransferCorridor that has a specific active power support.

PTCActivePowerSupport.RemedialActionSche.description: The RemedialActionScheme which has active power support from the PowerTransferCorridor.

ActivePower.description: Product of RMS value of the voltage and the RMS value of the in-phase component of the current.

PTCActivePowerSupport.maximum.description: Maximum support that a System Integrity Protection Scheme (SIPS) can provide to a Power Transfer Corridor (PTC). This is normally limited by the maximum power system disconnect allowed.

PTCActivePowerSupport.normal.description: Normal support that a System Integrity Protection Scheme (SIPS) is expected to provide when enabled to a Power Transfer Corridor (PTC).

PinContingency.description: Input pin associated with a Contingency. It is used for comparison.

GateInputPin.Gate.description: The Gate that has this input.

GateInputPin.absoluteValue.description: Indicates if the absolute value is used for comparison. If true, use the absolute value. If false, use the complex value (vector).

GateInputPin.duration.description: The time duration for which the condition is satisfied before acting. Default is 0 seconds.

GateInputPin.isValuePreFault.description: Indicates if the gate input pin value is referring to the value prior to a fault (e.g. simulated by a contingency or due to a SIPS activation in a N-x-y case). If it is true, it means that the value is referring to pre-fault. If it is false or not populated, then it is post-fault.

LogicalOperatorsKind.greaterThanOrEquals.description: Greater than or equals comparison operation.

LogicalOperatorsKind.lessThanOrEquals.description: Less than or equals comparison operation.

GateInputPin.logicKind.description: The logical operator kind used for comparison.

GateInputPin.negate.description: Invert/negate the result of the comparison.

GateInputPin.thresholdPercentage.description:
The threshold percentage that should be used for compare with the percentage change between input value and threshold value.
The allowed value range is [0,100].

GateInputPin.thresholdValue.description: The threshold value that should be used for compare with the input value.

PinContingency.Contingency.description: The Contingency that is used in the input pin.

PinDCTerminal.description: Input pin associated with a DCTerminal. It is used for comparison.

PinDCTerminal.DCTerminal.description: The DC terminal that has this pin DC terminal.

PinDCTerminalKind.voltage.description: Direct current voltage in the DCTerminal.

PinDCTerminal.kind.description: The kind of quantity which is used as an input value.

PinEquipment.description: Input pin associated with an Equipment. It is used for the comparison.

PinEquipment.Equipment.description: The Equipment that is used in the input pin.

PinEquipment.PropertyReference.description: The property reference for this pin equipment.

PinEquipmentTripping.description: Input pin associated with an Equipment. It is used to determine if the equipment is tripped between two consecutive stages, i.e. the equipment is in service at pre-fault stage and it is out of service at post-fault stage.

PinGate.description: An output from one gate represents an input to another gate.

PinMeasurement.description: Input pin associated with a Measurement. It is used for comparison.

PinMeasurement.Measurement.description: The Measurement that is used in the input pin.

PinMeasurement.MeasurementCalculator.description: The result of the calculation used as input to a gate.

PinOperationalLimit.description: Input pin associated with the limits of a Terminal. It is used for comparison.

PinOperationalLimit.OperationalLimit.description: The operational limit that is used in the input pin.

PinPowerTransferCorridor.description: Input pin associated with a PowerTransferCorridor. It is used for comparison.

PinPowerTransferCorridor.PowerTransferCo.description: The PowerTransferCorridor that is used in the input pin.

PinPowerTransferCorridorKind.activePower.description: Active power in the branch group.

PinPowerTransferCorridorKind.reactivePow.description: Reactive power in the branch group.

PinPowerTransferCorridor.kind.description: The kind of quantity which is used as an input value.

PinTerminal.description: Input pin associated with a Terminal. It is used for comparison.

PinTerminal.Terminal.description: The Terminal that is used in the input pin.

PinTerminal.kind.description: The kind of quantity which is used as an input value.

PowerElectronicsConnectionAction.PowerEl.description: The PowerElectronicsConnection that is applied to an action.

PowerShiftKeyStrategy.description: Strategy of the power shift key.

PowerShiftKeyStrategy.PowerRemedialActio.description: Power remedial acion which has power shift key strategy.

RedispatchRemedialAction.description: Redispatch remedial action is a remedial action that through rearranging power schedules is eliminating breaches of constraints.

RegulatingControlAction.description: Control action means the set point change of a regulating control power system resource in the grid model compared to the base case.

RegulatingControlAction.RegulatingContro.description: The regulating control which has an action.

RemedialActionDependency.description:
Remedial action dependency is making two remedial actions depending on each other. Multiple dependency is done by multiple instances of this class. The dependency can arrive by having one of the following examples.
  • The dependent remedial action is controlled by different system operator (Modeling Authority) (e.g. SIPS that goes across control area).
  • The dependent remedial action is representing two or more remedial action that represent the same grid state alteration but with different modeling resolution (e.g. detail direct current model versus a simplified model).
  • The remedial action can be combined with other remedial action without the need to create multiple remedial action with the same grid alteration for enabling dependency.

RemedialActionDependency.DependingRemedi.description: Remedial action group which the remedial action is depending on.

RemedialActionDependency.RemedialAction.description: Remedial action which has dependent remedial actions.

RemedialActionDependencyKind.balanced.description: This applies only to a set of power remedial actions (including HVDC which play role to balance power) and means that the remedial action needs to be balanced between the area (directly or indirectly to the bidding zone) that it is applied to.

RemedialActionDependencyKind.exclusive.description: Remedial actions are exclusive depending on each other. e.g. Only one of the remedial actions can be selected at the same time.

RemedialActionDependencyKind.inclusive.description: Remedial actions are inclusive depending on each other. e.g. Both remedial actions need to be picked if one of them is needed.

RemedialActionDependencyKind.none.description: Remedial actions are not depending on each other. However, the two remedial actions should be evaluated together.

RemedialActionDependencyKind.restrictive.description: Remedial actions are restrictive depending on each other. The need to include or to exclude might depend on the model. e.g. In the case of simplified DC model and detailed DC model. In the case where the simplified remedial action is used but not the remedial action for the detail model and opposite for the DC model.

RemedialActionDependency.kind.description: Type of dependency between two remedial actions.

RemedialActionDependency.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

RemedialActionDependency.normalEnabled.description: If true, the remedial action dependency within a group shall be considered under normal operating conditions.

RemedialActionGroup.description: Grouping of remedial actions that can be operated together.

RemedialActionScheme.description:
Remedial Action Scheme (RAS), Special Protection Schemes (SPS), System Protection Schemes (SPS) or System Integrity Protection Schemes (SIPS).
A Remedial Action Scheme consists of one or more stages that can trigger and execute a protection action.

RemedialActionScheme.GateArmed.description: Gate that through a gate logic and input pin defines arming of a Remedial Action Scheme.

RemedialActionScheme.SchemeRemedialActio.description: Scheme remedial action that belongs to the remedial action scheme.

RemedialActionSchemeKind.rasp.description: Remedial Action Schema Plan (RASP). The triggering conditions are met through calculation or manual intervention.

RemedialActionSchemeKind.sips.description: System Integrity Protection Scheme (SIPS). The triggering conditions are met through field measurements.

RemedialActionScheme.normalArmed.description: Defines the normal arming status of the remedial action scheme.

RemedialActionScheme.normallyInService.description: Indicates if the remedial action scheme and related assets are normally active and can participate in system operation under normal operating conditions. If true, the scheme is normally active. If false, the scheme is treated as if it is not in the model.

RotatingMachineAction.RotatingMachine.description: The rotating machine that has an action.

SchemeRemedialAction.description: Scheme remedial action is remedial action that involves a scheme that can include conditional logic and stages of grid alteration. The primary remedial action is the arming of these schemes, that will then perform curative remedial action when the condition is met. System Integrity Protection Scheme (SIPS) and Special Protection Scheme (SPS) are example of this.

ShuntCompensatorModification.ShuntCompen.description: The ShuntCompensator that is associated with an action.

Stage.description: Stage of a remedial action scheme.

Stage.GridStateAlterationCollection.description: The GridStateAlterationCollection which belongs to the Stage.

Stage.RemedialActionScheme.description: The remedial action scheme that has a stage.

Stage.priority.description: The priority of the stage.   0 = do not care (default) 1 = highest priority. 2 is less than 1 and so on. A stage with higher priority needs be activated before a lower stage can be activated.

StageTrigger.description: Stage that is triggered either by TriggerCondition or by gate condition within a stage.

StageTrigger.GateArmed.description: The gate that is the input pin which defines arming of the StageTrigger.

StageTrigger.GateComCondition.description: The gate that is the input pin which defines a communication condition.

StageTrigger.GateTrigger.description: The gate that is the input pin which triggers the protective reactions.

StageTrigger.Stage.description: The stage that has this stage trigger.

StageTrigger.normalArmed.description: The default/normal value used when other active signal/values are missing.

StageTrigger.priority.description: Priority of trigger. 0 = don t care (default) 1 = highest priority. 2 is less than 1 and so on. A trigger with the highest priority will trigger first.

StaticPropertyRange.description:
Defines the static range, which means that this is the minimum and/or maximum of an attribute value. The value provided by the schedule replaces the value of the attribute to which the schedule refers to.
In case that the PropertyReference refers to Boolean type attributes, RangeConstraint.direction shall be none or upAndDown and the RangeConstraint.valueKind shall be absolute. If the direction is none then optimization of the attribute referenced by the PropertyReference is not possible if the current status is already as the value in the range. Otherwise if the direction is upAndDown, the optimization can change from true to false or vice versa independently of the initial value in the operational scenario.
For instance for a tap changer related grid state alteration for a particular point in time, if the range of TapChanger.step is to be restricted, the value of the schedule will represent that new TapChanger.step range.

StaticPropertyRange.PropertyReference.description: Property reference for this static property range.

StaticVarCompensatorAction.StaticVarComp.description: The StaticVarCompensator which is associated with an action.

Substation.description: A collection of equipment for purposes other than generation or utilization, through which electric energy in bulk is passed for the purposes of switching or modifying its characteristics.

TapPositionAction.description: Tap position action represents a change of a tap changer position in the grid model compared to the base case.

TapPositionAction.TapChanger.description: The tap changer that has a tap position action associated.

TopologyAction.description: Topology action means the connection or disconnection of a switch in the grid model compared to the base case.

TopologyAction.Switch.description: The switch that has a topology action associated.

TriggerCondition.description: The condition that triggers a remedial action scheme.

TriggerCondition.GateTrigger.description: The gate that is the condition for the trigger.

TriggerCondition.RemedialActionScheme.description: The remedial action scheme that has the trigger condition.

Dataset.description: A collection of data, published or curated by a single source, and available for access or download in one or more representations.

URI.description: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) or URI Reference as defined by [RFC 3986], including amendments from [RFC 6874] for IPv6 zone identifiers. The value may be absolute or relative and can include an optional fragment identifier. This datatype is used to indicate that the value fulfills the role of a URI or URI Reference, providing a consistent format for referencing abstract or physical resources.

accessRights.description:
Information about who access the resource or an indication of its security status. Access Rights may include information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies.
[CIM context:
Reference to the confidentiality level that shall be applied when handling this model.].

accrualPeriodicity.description:
The frequency with which items are added to a collection.
[CIM context:
Reference to the time frame.].

conformsTo.description:
An established standard to which the described resource conforms.
[CIM context:
An IRI describing the profile that governs this model. It uniquely identifies the profile and its version. Multiple instances of the property describe all standards or specifications to which the model and the document representing this model conform to.
A document would normally conform to profile definitions, the constraints that relate to the profile and/or the set of business specific constrains. A reference to a machine- readable constraints or specification indicates that the document was tested against these constraints and it conforms to them.].

LangString.description: Datatype that conforms to rdf:langString, representing a textual value with an associated language tag, following BCP 47 language conventions (e.g., en, fr-CA, no-NB).

description.description:
A free-text account of the resource.
Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, a table of contents, a graphical representation, or a free-text account of the resource.

hasPart.description: The dataset which is part of another dataset.

UUID.description: Datatype representing a unique identifier in the form of a universally unique identifier (UUID). The value must conform to the UUID format as defined in RFC 4122, allowing for globally unique identification of entities.

identifier.description:
A unique identifier of the resource being described or cataloged.
The identifier might be used as part of the IRI of the resource, but still having it represented explicitly is useful.
The identifier is a text string which is assigned to the resource to provide an unambiguous reference within a particular context.
[CIM context:
A unique identifier of the model which is serialised in the document where the header is located. The identifier is persistent for a given version of the model and shall change when the model changes.
If a model is serialized as complete (full) model or as difference model exchange the identifier shall be the same. The identifier shall not be used as an identifier of the document which can be different for a given version of a model.].

DateTime.description: Date and time as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sss", which conforms with ISO 8601. UTC time zone is specified as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ". A local timezone relative UTC is specified as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sss-hh:mm". The second component (shown here as "ss.sss") could have any number of digits in its fractional part to allow any kind of precision beyond seconds.

issued.description:
Date of formal issuance of the resource.
Recommended practice is to describe the date, date/time, or period of time as recommended for the property Date, of which this is a subproperty.
[CIM context:
Reference to the date that the complete data set was made valid/available.].

license.description:
A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource. Recommended practice is to identify the license document with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value that identifies the license may be provided.
[CIM context:
Reference to the license under which the data is made available. If no license holder is defined, then the original data provider holds the license.].

publisher.description:
An entity responsible for making the resource available.
[CIM context: 
The agent that is publishing the dataset on the given platform.]

references.description:
A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise pointed to by the described resource[.
[CIM context: 
The referenced resource that is being complemented in this dataset, e.g. SSH is referencing EQ.]

replaces.description:
A related resource that is supplanted, displaced, or superseded by the described resource
[CIM context: 
The referenced dataset is being replaced by this dataset.]

requires.description: A related resource that is required by the described resource to support its function, delivery, or coherence.

rights.description: A statement that concerns all rights not addressed with dct:license or dct:accessRights, such as copyright statements.

rightsHolder.description:
Information about rights held in and over the resource.
Typically, rights information includes a statement about various property rights associated with the resource, including intellectual property rights. Recommended practice is to refer to a rights statement with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value (name, label, or short text) may be provided.

source.description:
A related resource from which the described resource is derived.
This property is intended to be used with non-literal values. The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a URI or a string conforming to a formal identification system.

spatial.description:
The geographical area covered by the dataset.
[CIM context: 
The responsibility area that multiple model can describe, also referred to frame.].

title.description: A name given to the resource.

type.description: The nature or genre of the resource. Recommended practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the DCMI Type Vocabulary [DCMI-TYPE]. To describe the file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource, use the property Format.

versionNotes.description: A description of changes between this version and the previous version of the resource.

DateTimeStamp.description: Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:dateTimeStamp, in which the time-zone field is mandatory.

endDate.description:
This property contains the end of the period.
[CIM context:
The end date and time of the validity period of the model that it is serialized in the document where the header is located. It is only used in relation to the startDate property which indicates the beginning of the validity period of the model.].

inSeries.description: A dataset series of which the dataset is part.

isVersionOf.description:
This resource has a more specific, versioned resource. This property is intended for relating a non-versioned or abstract resource to several versioned resources, e.g., snapshots.

The notion of version used by this property is limited to versions resulting from revisions occurring to a resource as part of its life-cycle. Therefore, its semantics is more specific than its super-property dcterms:hasVersion, which makes use of a broader notion of version, including editions and adaptations.

keyword.description:
A keyword or tag describing a resource.
[CIM context:
The intended content type of the model, usually the profile keyword. Used to identify what profiles and content is expected in the document, e.g., Equipment, Boundary, SSH, AE, etc. The same keyword is used for different versions of same profile. It can be also used to identify different content based on the same profile.
For instance, as the equipment profile can be used for both boundary data and equipment not related to boundary, the keyword is different to indicate that boundary data is exchanged. In order to avoid ambiguity the property is not exchanged in cases where the document contains multiple profiles referenced by dcterms:conformsTo.].

nextVersion.description: The next version for the resource.

previousVersion.description:
The previous version of a resource in a lineage.
This property is meant to be used to specify a version chain, consisting of snapshots of a resource.

The notion of version used by this property is limited to versions resulting from revisions occurring to a resource as part of its life-cycle. One of the typical cases here is representing the history of the versions of a dataset that have been released over time.

startDate.description:
This property contains the start of the period.
[CIM context:
The date and time that this model represents, i.e. for which the model is (or was) valid. It indicates the beginning of the validity period. It is indicating either an instant (in cases where the model is only valid for a point in time) or the start time of a period. If not provided the model is considered valid for any time stamp. The format is an extended format according to the ISO 8601-2005. European exchanges shall refer to UTC.].

temporalResolution.description:
Minimum time period resolvable in a dataset.
[CIM context: 
Describes the Market Time Unit (MTU), e.g. hourly, 15 min., etc.]

Version.description: Datatype representing a version identifier that follows Semantic Versioning (SemVer 2.0.0) principles: MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH[-PRERELEASE][+BUILD]. The version consists of a sequence of numbers and optional alphanumeric identifiers that indicate changes in a system, model, or software over time.

version.description: The version indicator (name or identifier) of a resource.

generatedAtTime.description:
Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.
[CIM context:
The date and time when the model was serialized in the document where the header is located. The format is an extended format according to the ISO 8601-2005. European exchanges shall refer to UTC.].

wasGeneratedBy.description:
Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.
[CIM context:
Reference to an activity or the exact business nature (process, configuration) which produced or uses the model.].

applicationSoftware.description:
Identifies the application software which generated this instance file. The application software term is defined in ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017. The application software can be identified either:
- as a string which contains information on the software name and version, e.g. <tool_name>-<major_version>.<minor_version>.<patch>, or
- as a reference to a software identification tag as defined by ISO/IEC 19770-2:2015 and ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017.

processType.description: The exact business nature. Reference to Business Process configurations.

usedSettings.description: Reference to a set of parameters describing used settings (e.g. power flow settings, process settings, etc.) applied to the model prior its serialisation.

alternativeVersionOf.description:
This resource is an alternative version of a non-versioned or abstract resource.
This property is intended for relating a versioned resource to a non-versioned or abstract resource at the same time express that multiple versions exist.
dcatcim:alternativeVersionOf is a specialisation of dcat:isVersionOf with the restriction that the resource shall have a preferred version (dcatcim:preferredVersion) so that the preferred dataset can be used when there is no need to access all alternative versions.
