ProfileMetadata.label: DocAvailabilityScheduleProfile

AvailabilityContainer.description: Availability container serves for associating an equipment container with an availability schedule. For instance, putting in or out of service all the equipment inside a Line or a Bay in combination with other availability functions with the same availability schedule.

String.description: A string consisting of a sequence of characters. The character encoding is UTF-8. The string length is unspecified and unlimited.

IdentifiedObject.description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

IdentifiedObject.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

IdentifiedObject.name.description: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

AvailabilityContainer.EquipmentContainer.description: Equipment container that is affected by the availability given by this availability container.

AvailabilityPowerSystemFunction.Availabi.description: Grouping for all availability power system functions (controlled by all relevant system operators) that have the same availability schedule.
Availability schedule for this availability power system function.

AvailabilityFunctionKind.underTesting.description: Function is under testing and need to expect unscheduled availability.

AvailabilityPowerSystemFunction.kind.description: Kind of availability that affect the power system function.

AvailabilityEnabled.description: Availability enabled is enabling or disabling grid state alteration (e.g. tap position action) or assessed element that is related to the availability schedule. For instance, the cancellation of availability schedule can lead to changes in the  assessed element. This is done by enabling one assessment and disabling another.

AvailabilityEnabled.AssessedElement.description: Assessed element that is affected by the availability given by this availability enabling.

AvailabilityEnabled.GridStateAlteration.description: Grid state alteration that is affected by the availability given by this availability enabling.

Boolean.description: A type with the value space "true" and "false".

AvailabilityEnabled.enabled.description: Instruction to enable or disable alteration and assessment.

AvailabilityEquipment.description: Availability equipment serves for associating an equipment with an availability schedule. For instance, putting in or out of service an ACLineSegment in combination with other availability functions with the same availability schedule.

AvailabilityEquipment.Equipment.description: Equipment that is affected by the availability given by this availability equipment.

AvailabilityExceptionalLimit.description: Availability exceptional limit serves for associating an operational limit restriction with an availability schedule. For instance, enabling or disabling the current limit on ACLineSegment terminal in combination with other availability functions with the same availability schedule or de-rating due to fault.

AvailabilityExceptionalLimit.Operational.description: Operational limit that is constrained by this availability exceptional limit.

Float.description: A floating point number. The range is unspecified and not limited.

AvailabilityExceptionalLimit.value.description: Value for the referred operational limit.

AvailabilityGroup.description: Container to link relevant equipment that is affected by (un)availability schedule across availability coordinator (e.g. TSO-TSO, TSO-DSO or DSO-DSO).

AvailabilityRemedialActionScheme.description: Availability remedial action scheme serves for associating a remedial action scheme with an availability schedule. For instance, taking in or out of service a SIPS / SPS due to communication issue, in combination with other availability functions with the same availability schedule.

AvailabilityRemedialActionScheme.Remedia.description: Remedial action scheme that is affected by the availability given by this availability remedial action scheme.

AvailabilitySchedule.description: A given (un)availability schedule with a given status and cause that include multiple equipment that need to follow the same scheduling periods.

AvailabilitySchedule.ActualSchedule.description: Actual schedule that relates to this availability schedule; used for ex-post reporting and analysis (e.g., to compare planned vs. actual).

AvailabilitySchedule.DependentOnSchedule.description: (Un)availability schedule requested by one operator may require another operator to request their (un)availability schedule. This association is linking the schedules so that the dependency is clear.

AvailabilitySchedule.GridStateAlteration.description: The grid state alteration collection that has this availability schedule.

AvailabilitySchedule.PlannedSchedule.description: Planned schedule that relates to this availability schedule used for planning availability (e.g., to compare planned vs. actual).

AvailabilitySchedule.PrioritySchedule.description: Priority schedule. This is the schedule that has the highest priority and the only valid if not cancelled.

AvailabilitySchedule.RemedialAction.description: Remedial action that is cancelling this availability schedule.

DateTime.description: Date and time as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sss", which conforms with ISO 8601. UTC time zone is specified as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ". A local timezone relative UTC is specified as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sss-hh:mm". The second component (shown here as "ss.sss") could have any number of digits in its fractional part to allow any kind of precision beyond seconds.

AvailabilitySchedule.cancelledDateTime.description: The date and time the (un)availability schedule were cancelled .

AvailabilitySchedule.causeDescription.description: A cause description for a cause kind. In case of CauseKind equals other, description or a reference of the cause of the (un)availability schedule.

AvailabilityScheduleCauseKind.commission.description: The cause is due to a commissioning.

AvailabilityScheduleCauseKind.decommissi.description: The cause is due to a decommissioning.

AvailabilityScheduleCauseKind.environmen.description: The cause is due to an environmental condition. This can lead to exceptional margin and limits.

AvailabilityScheduleCauseKind.functional.description: The cause is due to a functional control (in & out).

AvailabilityScheduleCauseKind.maintenanc.description: The cause is due to a maintenance.

AvailabilityScheduleCauseKind.other.description: The cause is of other kind.

AvailabilityScheduleCauseKind.refurbishm.description: The cause is due to a refurbishment, either upgrade or downgrade.

AvailabilityScheduleCauseKind.worksInPro.description: The cause is due to a works in proximity.

AvailabilitySchedule.causeKind.description: Kind of cause for the availability schedule.

Duration.description: Duration as "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS" which conforms to ISO 8601, where nY expresses a number of years, nM a number of months, nD a number of days. The letter T separates the date expression from the time expression and, after it, nH identifies a number of hours, nM a number of minutes and nS a number of seconds. The number of seconds could be expressed as a decimal number, but all other numbers are integers.

AvailabilitySchedule.daytimeRestitutionD.description: The time required to take the out-of-service equipment back into service during daytime. This includes the start-up time for generating units.

AvailabilitySchedule.eveningRestitutionD.description: The time required to take the out-of-service equipment back into service after office hours. This includes the start-up time for generating units.

AvailabilitySchedule.maxRestitutionDurat.description: The maximum time required to take the out-of-service equipment back into service. This includes the start-up time for generating units.

Integer.description: An integer number. The range is unspecified and not limited.

AvailabilitySchedule.priority.description: Value 0 means ignore priority. 1 means the highest priority, 2 is the second highest priority.

AvailabilitySchedule.weekendRestitutionD.description: The time required to take the out-of-service equipment back into service in the weekend or during bank holidays. This includes the start-up time for generating units.

EventSchedule.description: Time series represent irregular event described by event points in time.

TimeSeriesInterpolationKind.previous.description: The value between two time points is set to previous value.

BaseTimeSeries.interpolationKind.description: Kind of interpolation done between time point.

BaseTimeSeriesKind.actual.description: Time series is actual data. The values represent measured or calculated values that represent the actual behaviour.

BaseTimeSeriesKind.schedule.description: Time series is schedule data. The values represent the result of a committed and plan forecast data that has been through a quality control and could incur penalty when not followed.

EventTimePoint.description: Event valid for a given point in time.

EventTimePoint.EventSchedule.description: Time series the time point values belongs to.

EventTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

EventTimePoint.isActive.description: True, if the event is occurring (Active) at this time point. Otherwise false.

Dataset.description: A collection of data, published or curated by a single source, and available for access or download in one or more representations.

URI.description: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) or URI Reference as defined by [RFC 3986], including amendments from [RFC 6874] for IPv6 zone identifiers. The value may be absolute or relative and can include an optional fragment identifier. This datatype is used to indicate that the value fulfills the role of a URI or URI Reference, providing a consistent format for referencing abstract or physical resources.

accessRights.description:
Information about who access the resource or an indication of its security status. Access Rights may include information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies.
[CIM context:
Reference to the confidentiality level that shall be applied when handling this model.].

accrualPeriodicity.description:
The frequency with which items are added to a collection.
[CIM context:
Reference to the time frame.].

conformsTo.description:
An established standard to which the described resource conforms.
[CIM context:
An IRI describing the profile that governs this model. It uniquely identifies the profile and its version. Multiple instances of the property describe all standards or specifications to which the model and the document representing this model conform to.
A document would normally conform to profile definitions, the constraints that relate to the profile and/or the set of business specific constrains. A reference to a machine- readable constraints or specification indicates that the document was tested against these constraints and it conforms to them.].

LangString.description: Datatype that conforms to rdf:langString, representing a textual value with an associated language tag, following BCP 47 language conventions (e.g., en, fr-CA, no-NB).

description.description:
A free-text account of the resource.
Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, a table of contents, a graphical representation, or a free-text account of the resource.

hasPart.description: The dataset which is part of another dataset.

UUID.description: Datatype representing a unique identifier in the form of a universally unique identifier (UUID). The value must conform to the UUID format as defined in RFC 4122, allowing for globally unique identification of entities.

identifier.description:
A unique identifier of the resource being described or cataloged.
The identifier might be used as part of the IRI of the resource, but still having it represented explicitly is useful.
The identifier is a text string which is assigned to the resource to provide an unambiguous reference within a particular context.
[CIM context:
A unique identifier of the model which is serialised in the document where the header is located. The identifier is persistent for a given version of the model and shall change when the model changes.
If a model is serialized as complete (full) model or as difference model exchange the identifier shall be the same. The identifier shall not be used as an identifier of the document which can be different for a given version of a model.].

issued.description:
Date of formal issuance of the resource.
Recommended practice is to describe the date, date/time, or period of time as recommended for the property Date, of which this is a subproperty.
[CIM context:
Reference to the date that the complete data set was made valid/available.].

license.description:
A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource. Recommended practice is to identify the license document with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value that identifies the license may be provided.
[CIM context:
Reference to the license under which the data is made available. If no license holder is defined, then the original data provider holds the license.].

publisher.description:
An entity responsible for making the resource available.
[CIM context: 
The agent that is publishing the dataset on the given platform.]

references.description:
A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise pointed to by the described resource[.
[CIM context: 
The referenced resource that is being complemented in this dataset, e.g. SSH is referencing EQ.]

replaces.description:
A related resource that is supplanted, displaced, or superseded by the described resource
[CIM context: 
The referenced dataset is being replaced by this dataset.]

requires.description: A related resource that is required by the described resource to support its function, delivery, or coherence.

rights.description: A statement that concerns all rights not addressed with dct:license or dct:accessRights, such as copyright statements.

rightsHolder.description:
Information about rights held in and over the resource.
Typically, rights information includes a statement about various property rights associated with the resource, including intellectual property rights. Recommended practice is to refer to a rights statement with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value (name, label, or short text) may be provided.

source.description:
A related resource from which the described resource is derived.
This property is intended to be used with non-literal values. The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a URI or a string conforming to a formal identification system.

spatial.description:
The geographical area covered by the dataset.
[CIM context: 
The responsibility area that multiple model can describe, also referred to frame.].

title.description: A name given to the resource.

type.description: The nature or genre of the resource. Recommended practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the DCMI Type Vocabulary [DCMI-TYPE]. To describe the file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource, use the property Format.

versionNotes.description: A description of changes between this version and the previous version of the resource.

DateTimeStamp.description: Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:dateTimeStamp, in which the time-zone field is mandatory.

endDate.description:
This property contains the end of the period.
[CIM context:
The end date and time of the validity period of the model that it is serialized in the document where the header is located. It is only used in relation to the startDate property which indicates the beginning of the validity period of the model.].

inSeries.description: A dataset series of which the dataset is part.

isVersionOf.description:
This resource has a more specific, versioned resource. This property is intended for relating a non-versioned or abstract resource to several versioned resources, e.g., snapshots.

The notion of version used by this property is limited to versions resulting from revisions occurring to a resource as part of its life-cycle. Therefore, its semantics is more specific than its super-property dcterms:hasVersion, which makes use of a broader notion of version, including editions and adaptations.

keyword.description:
A keyword or tag describing a resource.
[CIM context:
The intended content type of the model, usually the profile keyword. Used to identify what profiles and content is expected in the document, e.g., Equipment, Boundary, SSH, AE, etc. The same keyword is used for different versions of same profile. It can be also used to identify different content based on the same profile.
For instance, as the equipment profile can be used for both boundary data and equipment not related to boundary, the keyword is different to indicate that boundary data is exchanged. In order to avoid ambiguity the property is not exchanged in cases where the document contains multiple profiles referenced by dcterms:conformsTo.].

nextVersion.description: The next version for the resource.

previousVersion.description:
The previous version of a resource in a lineage.
This property is meant to be used to specify a version chain, consisting of snapshots of a resource.

The notion of version used by this property is limited to versions resulting from revisions occurring to a resource as part of its life-cycle. One of the typical cases here is representing the history of the versions of a dataset that have been released over time.

startDate.description:
This property contains the start of the period.
[CIM context:
The date and time that this model represents, i.e. for which the model is (or was) valid. It indicates the beginning of the validity period. It is indicating either an instant (in cases where the model is only valid for a point in time) or the start time of a period. If not provided the model is considered valid for any time stamp. The format is an extended format according to the ISO 8601-2005. European exchanges shall refer to UTC.].

temporalResolution.description:
Minimum time period resolvable in a dataset.
[CIM context: 
Describes the Market Time Unit (MTU), e.g. hourly, 15 min., etc.]

Version.description: Datatype representing a version identifier that follows Semantic Versioning (SemVer 2.0.0) principles: MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH[-PRERELEASE][+BUILD]. The version consists of a sequence of numbers and optional alphanumeric identifiers that indicate changes in a system, model, or software over time.

version.description: The version indicator (name or identifier) of a resource.

generatedAtTime.description:
Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.
[CIM context:
The date and time when the model was serialized in the document where the header is located. The format is an extended format according to the ISO 8601-2005. European exchanges shall refer to UTC.].

wasGeneratedBy.description:
Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.
[CIM context:
Reference to an activity or the exact business nature (process, configuration) which produced or uses the model.].

applicationSoftware.description:
Identifies the application software which generated this instance file. The application software term is defined in ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017. The application software can be identified either:
- as a string which contains information on the software name and version, e.g. <tool_name>-<major_version>.<minor_version>.<patch>, or
- as a reference to a software identification tag as defined by ISO/IEC 19770-2:2015 and ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017.

processType.description: The exact business nature. Reference to Business Process configurations.

usedSettings.description: Reference to a set of parameters describing used settings (e.g. power flow settings, process settings, etc.) applied to the model prior its serialisation.

alternativeVersionOf.description:
This resource is an alternative version of a non-versioned or abstract resource.
This property is intended for relating a versioned resource to a non-versioned or abstract resource at the same time express that multiple versions exist.
dcatcim:alternativeVersionOf is a specialisation of dcat:isVersionOf with the restriction that the resource shall have a preferred version (dcatcim:preferredVersion) so that the preferred dataset can be used when there is no need to access all alternative versions.

preferredVersion.description:
The preferred version of a resource in a lineage of alternative versions.
This property is used to specify a specific version to be the preference in a chain of alternatives, consisting of snapshots of a resource.

DifferenceSet.description: A dataset that is represented by statement that describe the difference previous version by using forwardDifference Statement for item that is added and reverseDifference Statement for items that are removed. Items that are updated is described in both the forwardDifference and reversalDifference statements.

Statements.description: One or more facts in the form of an RDF triples that forms a cohesive description of change to a dataset.

forwardDifference.description: Statement that describes facts that has been added from previous version of the dataset.

reverseDifference.description: Statement that describes facts that has been removed from previous version of the dataset.

Statement.description: rdf:Statement is an instance of rdfs:Class. It is intended to represent the class of RDF statements. An RDF statement is the statement made by a token of an RDF triple. The subject of an RDF statement is the instance of rdfs:Resource identified by the subject of the triple. The predicate of an RDF statement is the instance of rdf:Property identified by the predicate of the triple. The object of an RDF statement is the instance of rdfs:Resource identified by the object of the triple. rdf:Statement is in the domain of the properties rdf:predicate, rdf:subject and rdf:object. Different individual rdf:Statement instances may have the same values for their rdf:predicate, rdf:subject and rdf:object properties.

statement.description: A name given to the resource.

ProfileMetadata.creator: ENTSO-E CIM WG NC project
ProfileMetadata.description: This vocabulary is describing the remedial action schedule profile.
ProfileMetadata.title: RemedialActionSchedule-AP-Voc-RDFS2020_v2-4-0.rdf
ProfileMetadata.comment: This package contains remedial action schedule profile.
ProfileMetadata.label: RemedialActionScheduleProfile

AvailabilitySchedule.description: A given (un)availability schedule with a given status and cause that include multiple equipment that need to follow the same scheduling periods.

String.description: A string consisting of a sequence of characters. The character encoding is UTF-8. The string length is unspecified and unlimited.

IdentifiedObject.description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

IdentifiedObject.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

IdentifiedObject.name.description: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

AvailabilitySchedule.RemedialAction.description: Remedial action that is cancelling this availability schedule.

Boolean.description: A type with the value space "true" and "false".

AvailabilitySchedule.isCancelled.description: Defines the cancelling of the availability schedule. True means that is cancelling, False means that it is not cancelling.

Integer.description: An integer number. The range is unspecified and not limited.

AvailabilitySchedule.priority.description: Value 0 means ignore priority. 1 means the highest priority, 2 is the second highest priority.

CountertradeScheduleAction.description: Countertrade schedule action is an action to rearrange power schedules based on a Generation and Load Shift Key (GLSK) strategy.

PowerScheduleAction.PowerBidSchedule.description: The power bid schedule which contains the power schedule action.

PowerScheduleAction.PowerSchedule.description: Power schedule which contains the power schedule action.

PowerScheduleAction.RemedialActionSchedu.description: Remedial action schedule which power schedule actions.

Currency.BMD.description: Bermudian dollar (customarily known as Bermuda dollar).

PowerScheduleAction.currency.description: Currency the energy price is given in.

Decimal.description: Decimal is the base-10 notational system for representing real numbers.

PowerScheduleAction.energyPrice.description: Energy price for the power schedule action.

EventSchedule.description: Time series represent irregular event described by event points in time.

TimeSeriesInterpolationKind.next.description: The value between two time points is set to next value.

BaseTimeSeries.interpolationKind.description: Kind of interpolation done between time point.

EventSchedule.RemedialActionSchedule.description: Remedial action schedule is the event that is validity for the given time series.

EventTimePoint.description: Event valid for a given point in time.

EventTimePoint.EventSchedule.description: Time series the time point values belongs to.

DateTime.description: Date and time as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sss", which conforms with ISO 8601. UTC time zone is specified as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ". A local timezone relative UTC is specified as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sss-hh:mm". The second component (shown here as "ss.sss") could have any number of digits in its fractional part to allow any kind of precision beyond seconds.

EventTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

EventTimePoint.isActive.description: True, if the event is occurring (Active) at this time point. Otherwise false.

GenericValueTimePoint.description: Generic value for a given point in time.

GenericValueTimePoint.GenericValueSchedu.description: Time series the time point values belongs to.

GenericValueTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

Float.description: A floating point number. The range is unspecified and not limited.

GenericValueTimePoint.value.description: The value at the time. The meaning of the value is defined by the derived type of the associated schedule. The value can be integer, float or boolean. In case of boolean 1 equals true and 0 equals false.

GridStateIntensitySchedule.description: Defines the intensity applied for a given grid state alteration. It is primarily used in exchanges related to the remedial action schedule. The value provided by the schedule replaces the value of the attribute to which the schedule refers to.

GenericValueSchedule.RemedialActionSched.description: Remedial action schedule which has generic value schedules.

GridStateIntensitySchedule.GridStateAlte.description: The grid state alteration which has intensity.

ValueOffsetKind.absolute.description: Value of the range constraint is replacing the attribute value referenced by the PropertyReference in a determined operational scenario.

ValueOffsetKind.incremental.description: Value of the range constraint is incrementing the attribute value referenced by the PropertyReference in a determined operational scenario.

ValueOffsetKind.incrementalPercentage.description: Value of the range constraint is incrementing in percentage the attribute value referenced by the PropertyReference in a determined operational scenario.

GridStateIntensitySchedule.valueKind.description: The kind of value1 and value2 of the associated IrregularIntervalSchedule.

PowerSchedule.description: Time series represent irregular power, active and reactive, values at given points in time.

PowerSchedule.currency.description: Currency the energy price is given in.

PowerTimePoint.description: Power, active and reactive, value at a given point in time.

PowerTimePoint.PowerSchedule.description: Time series the time point values belongs to.

ActivePower.description: Product of RMS value of the voltage and the RMS value of the in-phase component of the current.

PowerTimePoint.activatedP.description: Active power activated as part of redispatch. Negative number means that the value is scheduling down. Positive number means that the value is scheduling up.

PowerTimePoint.activatedPrice.description: Price for the activated active power per unit e.g. per MW.

PowerTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

PowerTimePoint.p.description: Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

PowerTimePoint.price.description: Price for the scheduled active power per unit of active power. e.g. per MW.

ReactivePower.description: Product of RMS value of the voltage and the RMS value of the quadrature component of the current.

PowerTimePoint.q.description: Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

ProposingRemedialActionScheduleShare.description: Proposing entity (System Operator) with a proper cost share for a given remedial action schedule.

ProposingRemedialActionScheduleShare.Pro.description: Proposing entity making the proposing remedial action schedule share.

ProposingRemedialActionScheduleShare.Rem.description: Remedial action schedule proposed by the proposing entity.

ProposingRemedialActionScheduleShare.cos.description: Sharing factor of the cost of the remedial action as a  fraction of the total cost, i.e. system operator's cost = cost x (costSharingFactor / sum of all costSharingFactor).

ProposingRemedialActionScheduleShare.mRI.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

RedispatchScheduleAction.description: Redispatch schedule action is an action to rearrange power schedules for a scheduled resource to obtain a feasible and secure operational state of the power electricity system.

RemedialActionCost.description: Remedial action cost is the total cost itemised cost by category and type for the remedial action.

RemedialActionCost.RemedialActionSchedul.description: Remedial action schedule for which this remedial action cost relates to.

RemedialActionCost.costAllocationTime.description: Cost allocation time is the time the cost shall be allocated.

CostSettledKind.final.description: Final cost. For instance, the cost is not expected to be changed on a later stage.

RemedialActionCost.kind.description: Remedial action cost category related to the confirmation of the cost in regards to changes.

RemedialActionCost.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

RemedialActionCost.operationalCost.description: Operational cost is the total cost directly related to operate the unit according to the remedial action, e.g. fuel cost.

RemedialActionCost.opportunityCost.description: Opportunity cost is the total cost of potential earning that is missed due to performing the remedial action.

RemedialActionCost.otherCost.description: Other cost is the total cost that cannot be directly allocated to any of the other items.

RemedialActionCost.processingFee.description: Processing fee is the total cost for processing the remedial action.

RemedialActionCost.savedFuelCost.description: Saved fuel cost is the total saving due to not consuming the expected fuel as part of the remedial action.

RemedialActionCost.shutdownCost.description: Shutdown cost is the total cost for shutting down a unit as part of the remedial action.

RemedialActionCost.startupCost.description: Start-up cost is the total cost for activating the remedial action, e.g. if a generator needs to be started before it can perform the remedial action.

RemedialActionSchedule.description: A schedule for a determined remedial action.

RemedialActionSchedule.AssignedRegion.description: The assigned region for this remedial action schedule.

RemedialActionSchedule.Contingency.description: The contingency for a curative remedial action schedule.

RemedialActionSchedule.ProposingEntity.description: The security coordinator that is proposing this remedial action schedule.

RemedialActionSchedule.RemedialAction.description: The remedial action that has a remedial action schedule associated.

RemedialActionScheduleStatusKind.agreeme.description: The agreement is validated for the remedial action schedule.

RemedialActionScheduleStatusKind.impleme.description: An ordered remedial action is implemented.

RemedialActionScheduleStatusKind.rejecti.description: The rejection is validated for the remedial action schedule.

RemedialActionSchedule.statusKind.description: Indicates the status kind for the remedial action schedule.

RemedialActionSchedule.statusReason.description: Description of reasoning for the status. For instance, in case of rejected remedial action, the reason for this rejection is described here.

RemedialActionSchedule.totalCostCurrency.description: The currency of the total cost.

RemedialActionScheduleDependency.description: Remedial action schedule dependency is making two remedial action schedules depending on each other.

RemedialActionScheduleDependency.Propose.description: Proposed remedial action schedule that has dependency.

RemedialActionScheduleDependency.Remedia.description: Remedial action schedule group which has remedial action schedule dependency.

RemedialActionScheduleDependency.Replace.description: Remedial action schedule that is replaced by dependent remedial action schedule.

RemedialActionScheduleDependencyKind.exc.description: Remedial action schedules are exclusive depending on each other. e.g. Only one of the remedial action schedules can be selected at the same time.

RemedialActionScheduleDependencyKind.inc.description: Remedial action schedules are inclusive depending on each other. e.g. Both remedial action schedules need to be picked if one of them is needed.

RemedialActionScheduleDependencyKind.non.description: Remedial action schedules are not depending on each other. However, the two remedial action schedules should be evaluated together.

RemedialActionScheduleDependency.kind.description: Type of dependency between two remedial action schedules.

RemedialActionScheduleDependency.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

RemedialActionScheduleGroup.description: Remedial action schedule group collects two or more remedial action schedules together. The remedial action schedule group needs to be set up for the same remedial action or proposing alternative remedial action by including a reference to another remedial action.

RemedialActionScheduleResponse.description: The response on the remedial action schedule by a given system operator.

RemedialActionScheduleResponse.RemedialA.description: A remedial action schedule for which a remedial action schedule response is reported.

RemedialActionScheduleResponse.Respondin.description: An entity for which a remedial action schedule response is reported.

RemedialActionScheduleResponseKind.accep.description: The acceptance of remedial action schedule is concluded and accepted.

RemedialActionScheduleResponseKind.refus.description: The acceptance of the remedial action schedule is concluded and refused.

RemedialActionScheduleResponseKind.timeo.description: The acceptance of the remedial action schedule was not completed due to timeout.

RemedialActionScheduleResponseKind.waiti.description: The acceptance of the remedial action schedule is waiting (in progress).

RemedialActionScheduleResponse.kind.description: The kind of the remedial action response.

RemedialActionScheduleResponse.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

RemedialActionScheduleResponse.rejection.description: An additional type of rejection reason. It is used only when rejectionReasonKind equals RejectionReasonKind.other.

RejectionReasonKind.madeAlternative.description: The rejection is due to a proposal of an alternative remedial action.

RejectionReasonKind.noTimeToImplement.description: The rejection is due to lack of time to realise the proposed remedial action.

RejectionReasonKind.notAvailable.description: The rejection is due to unavailability of the object.

RejectionReasonKind.other.description: The rejection is due to other more complex reason or the details are unknown.

RejectionReasonKind.securityLimit.description: The rejection is due to security limit violation.

RemedialActionScheduleResponse.rejection.description: The kind of the remedial action rejection reason.

RemedialActionSchemeSchedule.description: The schedule for a remedial action scheme.

RemedialActionSchemeSchedule.SchemeRemed.description: Remedial action scheme which has remedial action scheme schedules.

SchemeRemedialAction.description: Scheme remedial action is remedial action that involves a scheme that can include conditional logic and stages of grid alteration. The primary remedial action is the arming of these schemes, that will then perform curative remedial action when the condition is met. System Integrity Protection Scheme (SIPS) and Special Protection Scheme (SPS) are example of this.

Dataset.description: A collection of data, published or curated by a single source, and available for access or download in one or more representations.

URI.description: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) or URI Reference as defined by [RFC 3986], including amendments from [RFC 6874] for IPv6 zone identifiers. The value may be absolute or relative and can include an optional fragment identifier. This datatype is used to indicate that the value fulfills the role of a URI or URI Reference, providing a consistent format for referencing abstract or physical resources.

accessRights.description:
Information about who access the resource or an indication of its security status. Access Rights may include information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies.
[CIM context:
Reference to the confidentiality level that shall be applied when handling this model.].

accrualPeriodicity.description:
The frequency with which items are added to a collection.
[CIM context:
Reference to the time frame.].

conformsTo.description:
An established standard to which the described resource conforms.
[CIM context:
An IRI describing the profile that governs this model. It uniquely identifies the profile and its version. Multiple instances of the property describe all standards or specifications to which the model and the document representing this model conform to.
A document would normally conform to profile definitions, the constraints that relate to the profile and/or the set of business specific constrains. A reference to a machine- readable constraints or specification indicates that the document was tested against these constraints and it conforms to them.].

LangString.description: Datatype that conforms to rdf:langString, representing a textual value with an associated language tag, following BCP 47 language conventions (e.g., en, fr-CA, no-NB).

description.description:
A free-text account of the resource.
Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, a table of contents, a graphical representation, or a free-text account of the resource.

hasPart.description: The dataset which is part of another dataset.

UUID.description: Datatype representing a unique identifier in the form of a universally unique identifier (UUID). The value must conform to the UUID format as defined in RFC 4122, allowing for globally unique identification of entities.

identifier.description:
A unique identifier of the resource being described or cataloged.
The identifier might be used as part of the IRI of the resource, but still having it represented explicitly is useful.
The identifier is a text string which is assigned to the resource to provide an unambiguous reference within a particular context.
[CIM context:
A unique identifier of the model which is serialised in the document where the header is located. The identifier is persistent for a given version of the model and shall change when the model changes.
If a model is serialized as complete (full) model or as difference model exchange the identifier shall be the same. The identifier shall not be used as an identifier of the document which can be different for a given version of a model.].

issued.description:
Date of formal issuance of the resource.
Recommended practice is to describe the date, date/time, or period of time as recommended for the property Date, of which this is a subproperty.
[CIM context:
Reference to the date that the complete data set was made valid/available.].

license.description:
A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource. Recommended practice is to identify the license document with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value that identifies the license may be provided.
[CIM context:
Reference to the license under which the data is made available. If no license holder is defined, then the original data provider holds the license.].

publisher.description:
An entity responsible for making the resource available.
[CIM context: 
The agent that is publishing the dataset on the given platform.]

references.description:
A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise pointed to by the described resource[.
[CIM context: 
The referenced resource that is being complemented in this dataset, e.g. SSH is referencing EQ.]

replaces.description:
A related resource that is supplanted, displaced, or superseded by the described resource
[CIM context: 
The referenced dataset is being replaced by this dataset.]

requires.description: A related resource that is required by the described resource to support its function, delivery, or coherence.

rights.description: A statement that concerns all rights not addressed with dct:license or dct:accessRights, such as copyright statements.

rightsHolder.description:
Information about rights held in and over the resource.
Typically, rights information includes a statement about various property rights associated with the resource, including intellectual property rights. Recommended practice is to refer to a rights statement with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value (name, label, or short text) may be provided.

source.description:
A related resource from which the described resource is derived.
This property is intended to be used with non-literal values. The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a URI or a string conforming to a formal identification system.

spatial.description:
The geographical area covered by the dataset.
[CIM context: 
The responsibility area that multiple model can describe, also referred to frame.].

title.description: A name given to the resource.

type.description: The nature or genre of the resource. Recommended practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the DCMI Type Vocabulary [DCMI-TYPE]. To describe the file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource, use the property Format.

versionNotes.description: A description of changes between this version and the previous version of the resource.

DateTimeStamp.description: Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:dateTimeStamp, in which the time-zone field is mandatory.

endDate.description:
This property contains the end of the period.
[CIM context:
The end date and time of the validity period of the model that it is serialized in the document where the header is located. It is only used in relation to the startDate property which indicates the beginning of the validity period of the model.].

inSeries.description: A dataset series of which the dataset is part.

isVersionOf.description:
This resource has a more specific, versioned resource. This property is intended for relating a non-versioned or abstract resource to several versioned resources, e.g., snapshots.

The notion of version used by this property is limited to versions resulting from revisions occurring to a resource as part of its life-cycle. Therefore, its semantics is more specific than its super-property dcterms:hasVersion, which makes use of a broader notion of version, including editions and adaptations.

keyword.description:
A keyword or tag describing a resource.
[CIM context:
The intended content type of the model, usually the profile keyword. Used to identify what profiles and content is expected in the document, e.g., Equipment, Boundary, SSH, AE, etc. The same keyword is used for different versions of same profile. It can be also used to identify different content based on the same profile.
For instance, as the equipment profile can be used for both boundary data and equipment not related to boundary, the keyword is different to indicate that boundary data is exchanged. In order to avoid ambiguity the property is not exchanged in cases where the document contains multiple profiles referenced by dcterms:conformsTo.].

nextVersion.description: The next version for the resource.

previousVersion.description:
The previous version of a resource in a lineage.
This property is meant to be used to specify a version chain, consisting of snapshots of a resource.

The notion of version used by this property is limited to versions resulting from revisions occurring to a resource as part of its life-cycle. One of the typical cases here is representing the history of the versions of a dataset that have been released over time.

startDate.description:
This property contains the start of the period.
[CIM context:
The date and time that this model represents, i.e. for which the model is (or was) valid. It indicates the beginning of the validity period. It is indicating either an instant (in cases where the model is only valid for a point in time) or the start time of a period. If not provided the model is considered valid for any time stamp. The format is an extended format according to the ISO 8601-2005. European exchanges shall refer to UTC.].

Duration.description: Duration as "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS" which conforms to ISO 8601, where nY expresses a number of years, nM a number of months, nD a number of days. The letter T separates the date expression from the time expression and, after it, nH identifies a number of hours, nM a number of minutes and nS a number of seconds. The number of seconds could be expressed as a decimal number, but all other numbers are integers.

temporalResolution.description:
Minimum time period resolvable in a dataset.
[CIM context: 
Describes the Market Time Unit (MTU), e.g. hourly, 15 min., etc.]

Version.description: Datatype representing a version identifier that follows Semantic Versioning (SemVer 2.0.0) principles: MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH[-PRERELEASE][+BUILD]. The version consists of a sequence of numbers and optional alphanumeric identifiers that indicate changes in a system, model, or software over time.

version.description: The version indicator (name or identifier) of a resource.

generatedAtTime.description:
Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.
[CIM context:
The date and time when the model was serialized in the document where the header is located. The format is an extended format according to the ISO 8601-2005. European exchanges shall refer to UTC.].

wasGeneratedBy.description:
Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.
[CIM context:
Reference to an activity or the exact business nature (process, configuration) which produced or uses the model.].

applicationSoftware.description:
Identifies the application software which generated this instance file. The application software term is defined in ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017. The application software can be identified either:
- as a string which contains information on the software name and version, e.g. <tool_name>-<major_version>.<minor_version>.<patch>, or
- as a reference to a software identification tag as defined by ISO/IEC 19770-2:2015 and ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017.

processType.description: The exact business nature. Reference to Business Process configurations.

usedSettings.description: Reference to a set of parameters describing used settings (e.g. power flow settings, process settings, etc.) applied to the model prior its serialisation.

alternativeVersionOf.description:
This resource is an alternative version of a non-versioned or abstract resource.
This property is intended for relating a versioned resource to a non-versioned or abstract resource at the same time express that multiple versions exist.
dcatcim:alternativeVersionOf is a specialisation of dcat:isVersionOf with the restriction that the resource shall have a preferred version (dcatcim:preferredVersion) so that the preferred dataset can be used when there is no need to access all alternative versions.

preferredVersion.description:
The preferred version of a resource in a lineage of alternative versions.
This property is used to specify a specific version to be the preference in a chain of alternatives, consisting of snapshots of a resource.

DifferenceSet.description: A dataset that is represented by statement that describe the difference previous version by using forwardDifference Statement for item that is added and reverseDifference Statement for items that are removed. Items that are updated is described in both the forwardDifference and reversalDifference statements.

Statements.description: One or more facts in the form of an RDF triples that forms a cohesive description of change to a dataset.

forwardDifference.description: Statement that describes facts that has been added from previous version of the dataset.

reverseDifference.description: Statement that describes facts that has been removed from previous version of the dataset.

Statement.description: rdf:Statement is an instance of rdfs:Class. It is intended to represent the class of RDF statements. An RDF statement is the statement made by a token of an RDF triple. The subject of an RDF statement is the instance of rdfs:Resource identified by the subject of the triple. The predicate of an RDF statement is the instance of rdf:Property identified by the predicate of the triple. The object of an RDF statement is the instance of rdfs:Resource identified by the object of the triple. rdf:Statement is in the domain of the properties rdf:predicate, rdf:subject and rdf:object. Different individual rdf:Statement instances may have the same values for their rdf:predicate, rdf:subject and rdf:object properties.

statement.description: A name given to the resource.

ProfileMetadata.creator: ENTSO-E CIM WG NC project
ProfileMetadata.description: This vocabulary is describing the sensitivity matrix.
ProfileMetadata.title: SensitivityMatrix-AP-Voc-RDFS2020_v2-3-3.rdf
ProfileMetadata.comment: This package contains sensitivity matrix profile.
ProfileMetadata.label: SensitivityMatrixProfile

ControllableQuantity.description: Controllable quantity is a set point quantity on a grid state alteration or on a remedial action.

ControllableQuantity.GridStateAlteration.description: The grid state alteration for this controllable quantity.

ControllableQuantity.RemedialAction.description: Remedial action which is associated with the controllable quantity.

Float.description: A floating point number. The range is unspecified and not limited.

ControllableQuantity.value.description: The value of the change applied to the grid state alteration or remedial action. In the case of multiple changes or non-quantifiable changes (e.g. Topology changes) the value needs to represent the suitable value that makes the derivable value given in the observable quantity for the purpose of the calculation of the sensitivity factor.  The value can be integer, float or boolean. In case of boolean 1 equals true and 0 equals false.

ObservableQuantity.description: Observable quantity is an electrical quantity on an assessed element or an assessed element with contingency.

ObservableQuantity.AssessedElement.description: The assessed element with contingency associated with this observable quantity.

ObservableQuantity.Contingency.description: The contingency associated with this observable quantity.

ObservableQuantityKind.activePower.description: The observable quantity is the active power.

ObservableQuantityKind.reactivePower.description: The observable quantity is the reactive power.

ObservableQuantityKind.voltageAngle.description: The observable quantity is the angle of terminal voltage.

ObservableQuantityKind.voltageMagnitude.description: The observable quantity is the magnitude of terminal voltage.

SensitivityFactor.description: The sensitivity factor which represents the sensitivity between observable and controllable elements.

SensitivityFactor.ControllableQuantity.description: The controllable quantity for this sensitivity factor.

SensitivityFactor.ObservableQuantity.description: The observable quantity for this sensitivity factor.

SensitivityFactor.SensitivityMatrix.description: The sensitivity matrix which contains this sensitivity factor.

SensitivityFactor.value.description: The value of the sensitivity factor.

SensitivityMatrix.description: The sensitivity matrix which represents the sensitivity factors between observable and controllable elements.

String.description: A string consisting of a sequence of characters. The character encoding is UTF-8. The string length is unspecified and unlimited.

IdentifiedObject.description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

IdentifiedObject.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

IdentifiedObject.name.description: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

SensitivityMatrixKind.zoneToSlack.description: Zone to slack kind of sensitivity matrix.

A local timezone relative UTC is specified as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sss-hh:mm". The second component (shown here as "ss.sss") could have any number of digits in its fractional part to allow any kind of precision beyond seconds.

IdentifiedObject.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

IdentifiedObject.name.description: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

ActivePowerLimitSchedule.ActivePowerLimi.description: Active power limit which has active power limit schedules.

DateTime.description: Date and time as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sss", which conforms with ISO 8601. UTC time zone is specified as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ". A local timezone relative UTC is specified as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sss-hh:mm". The second component (shown here as "ss.sss") could have any number of digits in its fractional part to allow any kind of precision beyond seconds.

BaseTimeSeries.generatedAtTime.description: The time this time series (entity) come to existents and available for use.

TimeSeriesInterpolationKind.linear.description: Linear interpolation is applied for values between two time points.

TimeSeriesInterpolationKind.next.description: The value between two time points is set to next value.

TimeSeriesInterpolationKind.previous.description: The value between two time points is set to previous value.

TimeSeriesInterpolationKind.zero.description: The value between two time points is set to zero.

BaseTimeSeries.interpolationKind.description: Kind of interpolation done between time point.

Integer.description: An integer number. The range is unspecified and not limited.

BaseTimeSeries.percentile.description: The percentile is a number where a certain percentage of scores/ranking/values of a sample fall below that number. This is a way for expressing uncertainty in the number provided.

BaseTimeSeriesKind.actual.description: Time series is actual data. The values represent measured or calculated values that represent the actual behaviour.

BaseTimeSeriesKind.forecast.description: Time series is forecast data. The values represent the result of scientific predictions based on historical time stamped data.

BaseTimeSeriesKind.hindcast.description: Time series is hindcast data. The value represent probable past (historic) condition given by calculation done using actual values. For instance, determine the among of wind based on the energy produced by wind. However, hindcast is typical the result of a simulated forecasts for historical periods.

BaseTimeSeriesKind.schedule.description: Time series is schedule data. The values represent the result of a committed and plan forecast data that has been through a quality control and could incur penalty when not followed.

ShuntCompensatorTimePoint.sections.description:
Shunt compensator sections in use. Starting value for steady state solution. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero. Non integer values are allowed to support continuous variables. The reasons for continuous value are to support study cases where no discrete shunt compensators has yet been designed, a solutions where a narrow voltage band force the sections to oscillate or accommodate for a continuous solution as input. 
For LinearShuntConpensator the value shall be between zero and ShuntCompensator.maximumSections. At value zero the shunt compensator conductance and admittance is zero. Linear interpolation of conductance and admittance between the previous and next integer section is applied in case of non-integer values.
For NonlinearShuntCompensator-s shall only be set to one of the NonlinearShuntCompenstorPoint.sectionNumber. There is no interpolation between NonlinearShuntCompenstorPoint-s.

SwitchRegularSchedule.locked.description:
If true, the switch is locked. The resulting switch state is a combination of locked and Switch.open attributes as follows:
  • locked=true and Switch.open=true. The resulting state is open and locked;
  • locked=false and Switch.open=true. The resulting state is open;
  • locked=false and Switch.open=false. The resulting state is closed.

SwitchRegularSchedule.open.description: The attribute tells if the switch is considered open when used as input to topology processing.

  • locked=false and Switch.open=true. The resulting state is open;
  • locked=false and Switch.open=false. The resulting state is closed.

SwitchTimePoint.open.description: The attribute tells if the switch is considered open when used as input to topology processing.

TapRegularSchedule.controlEnabled.description: Specifies the regulation status of the equipment.  True is regulating, false is not regulating.

TapRegularSchedule.step.description:
Tap changer position.
Starting step for a steady state solution. Non integer values are allowed to support continuous tap variables. The reasons for continuous value are to support study cases where no discrete tap changer has yet been designed, a solution where a narrow voltage band forces the tap step to oscillate or to accommodate for a continuous solution as input.
The attribute shall be equal to or greater than lowStep and equal to or less than highStep.

TapScheduleTimePoint.step.description:
Tap changer position.
Starting step for a steady state solution. Non integer values are allowed to support continuous tap variables. The reasons for continuous value are to support study cases where no discrete tap changer has yet been designed, a solution where a narrow voltage band forces the tap step to oscillate or to accommodate for a continuous solution as input.
The attribute shall be equal to or greater than lowStep and equal to or less than highStep.
