VsConverterRegularSchedule.droop.description: Droop constant. The pu value is obtained as D [kV/MW] x Sb / Ubdc. The attribute shall be a positive value.

VsConverterRegularSchedule.droopCompensa.description: Compensation constant. Used to compensate for voltage drop when controlling voltage at a distant bus. The attribute shall be a positive value.

VsPpccControlKind.pPcc.description: Control is real power at point of common coupling. The target value is provided by ACDCConverter.targetPpcc.

VsPpccControlKind.pPccAndUdcDroop.description: Control is active power at point of common coupling and local DC voltage, with the droop. Target values are provided by ACDCConverter.targetPpcc, ACDCConverter.targetUdc and VsConverter.droop.

VsPpccControlKind.pPccAndUdcDroopPilot.description: Control is active power at point of common coupling and the pilot DC voltage, with the droop. The mode is used for Multi Terminal High Voltage DC (MTDC) systems where multiple HVDC Substations are connected to the HVDC transmission lines. The pilot voltage is then used to coordinate the control the DC voltage across the HVDC substations. Targets are provided by ACDCConverter.targetPpcc, ACDCConverter.targetUdc and  VsConverter.droop.

VsPpccControlKind.pPccAndUdcDroopWithCom.description: Control is active power at point of common coupling and compensated DC voltage, with the droop. Compensation factor is the resistance, as an approximation of the DC voltage of a common (real or virtual) node in the DC network. Targets are provided by ACDCConverter.targetPpcc, ACDCConverter.targetUdc, VsConverter.droop and VsConverter.droopCompensation.

VsPpccControlKind.phasePcc.description: Control is phase at point of common coupling. Target is provided by VsConverter.targetPhasePcc.

VsPpccControlKind.udc.description: Control is DC voltage  with target value provided by ACDCConverter.targetUdc.

VsConverterRegularSchedule.pPccControl.description: Kind of control of real power and/or DC voltage.

VsQpccControlKind.powerFactorPcc.description: Control is power factor at point of common coupling. Target is provided by VsConverter.targetPowerFactorPcc.

VsQpccControlKind.pulseWidthModulation.description: No explicit control. Pulse-modulation factor is directly set in magnitude (VsConverter.targetPWMfactor) and phase (VsConverter.targetPhasePcc).

VsQpccControlKind.reactivePcc.description: Control is reactive power at point of common coupling. Target is provided by VsConverter.targetQpcc.

VsQpccControlKind.voltagePcc.description: Control is voltage at point of common coupling. Target is provided by VsConverter.targetUpcc.

PerCent.description: Percentage on a defined base.   For example, specify as 100 to indicate at the defined base.

VsConverterRegularSchedule.qShare.description: Reactive power sharing factor among parallel converters on Uac control. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

VsConverterRegularSchedule.targetPWMfact.description: Magnitude of pulse-modulation factor. The attribute shall be a positive value.

VsConverterRegularSchedule.targetPhasePc.description: Phase target at AC side, at point of common coupling. The attribute shall be a positive value.

VsConverterRegularSchedule.targetPowerFa.description: Power factor target at the AC side, at point of common coupling. The attribute shall be a positive value.

VsConverterRegularSchedule.targetQpcc.description: Reactive power injection target in AC grid, at point of common coupling.  Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

VsConverterRegularSchedule.targetUpcc.description: Voltage target in AC grid, at point of common coupling. The attribute shall be a positive value.

VsConverterSchedule.VsConverter.description: Vs converter which has Vs converter schedules.

VsConverterTimePoint.description: VS converter values for a given point in time.

VsConverterTimePoint.VsConverterSchedule.description: The VS converter schedule that has this time point.

VsConverterTimePoint.droop.description: Droop constant. The pu value is obtained as D [kV/MW] x Sb / Ubdc. The attribute shall be a positive value.

VsConverterTimePoint.droopCompensation.description: Compensation constant. Used to compensate for voltage drop when controlling voltage at a distant bus. The attribute shall be a positive value.

VsConverterTimePoint.pPccControl.description: Kind of control of real power and/or DC voltage.

VsConverterTimePoint.qShare.description: Reactive power sharing factor among parallel converters on Uac control. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

VsConverterTimePoint.targetPWMfactor.description: Magnitude of pulse-modulation factor. The attribute shall be a positive value.

VsConverterTimePoint.targetPhasePcc.description: Phase target at AC side, at point of common coupling. The attribute shall be a positive value.

VsConverterTimePoint.targetPowerFactorPc.description: Power factor target at the AC side, at point of common coupling. The attribute shall be a positive value.

VsConverterTimePoint.targetQpcc.description: Reactive power injection target in AC grid, at point of common coupling.  Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

VsConverterTimePoint.targetUpcc.description: Voltage target in AC grid, at point of common coupling. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Dataset.description: A collection of data, published or curated by a single source, and available for access or download in one or more representations.

URI.description: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) or URI Reference as defined by [RFC 3986], including amendments from [RFC 6874] for IPv6 zone identifiers. The value may be absolute or relative and can include an optional fragment identifier. This datatype is used to indicate that the value fulfills the role of a URI or URI Reference, providing a consistent format for referencing abstract or physical resources.

accessRights.description:
Information about who access the resource or an indication of its security status. Access Rights may include information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies.
[CIM context:
Reference to the confidentiality level that shall be applied when handling this model.].

accrualPeriodicity.description:
The frequency with which items are added to a collection.
[CIM context:
Reference to the time frame.].

conformsTo.description:
An established standard to which the described resource conforms.
[CIM context:
An IRI describing the profile that governs this model. It uniquely identifies the profile and its version. Multiple instances of the property describe all standards or specifications to which the model and the document representing this model conform to.
A document would normally conform to profile definitions, the constraints that relate to the profile and/or the set of business specific constrains. A reference to a machine- readable constraints or specification indicates that the document was tested against these constraints and it conforms to them.].

LangString.description: Datatype that conforms to rdf:langString, representing a textual value with an associated language tag, following BCP 47 language conventions (e.g., en, fr-CA, no-NB).

description.description:
A free-text account of the resource.
Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, a table of contents, a graphical representation, or a free-text account of the resource.

hasPart.description: The dataset which is part of another dataset.

UUID.description: Datatype representing a unique identifier in the form of a universally unique identifier (UUID). The value must conform to the UUID format as defined in RFC 4122, allowing for globally unique identification of entities.

identifier.description:
A unique identifier of the resource being described or cataloged.
The identifier might be used as part of the IRI of the resource, but still having it represented explicitly is useful.
The identifier is a text string which is assigned to the resource to provide an unambiguous reference within a particular context.
[CIM context:
A unique identifier of the model which is serialised in the document where the header is located. The identifier is persistent for a given version of the model and shall change when the model changes.
If a model is serialized as complete (full) model or as difference model exchange the identifier shall be the same. The identifier shall not be used as an identifier of the document which can be different for a given version of a model.].

issued.description:
Date of formal issuance of the resource.
Recommended practice is to describe the date, date/time, or period of time as recommended for the property Date, of which this is a subproperty.
[CIM context:
Reference to the date that the complete data set was made valid/available.].

license.description:
A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource. Recommended practice is to identify the license document with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value that identifies the license may be provided.
[CIM context:
Reference to the license under which the data is made available. If no license holder is defined, then the original data provider holds the license.].

publisher.description:
An entity responsible for making the resource available.
[CIM context: 
The agent that is publishing the dataset on the given platform.]

references.description:
A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise pointed to by the described resource[.
[CIM context: 
The referenced resource that is being complemented in this dataset, e.g. SSH is referencing EQ.]

replaces.description:
A related resource that is supplanted, displaced, or superseded by the described resource
[CIM context: 
The referenced dataset is being replaced by this dataset.]

requires.description: A related resource that is required by the described resource to support its function, delivery, or coherence.

rights.description: A statement that concerns all rights not addressed with dct:license or dct:accessRights, such as copyright statements.

rightsHolder.description:
Information about rights held in and over the resource.
Typically, rights information includes a statement about various property rights associated with the resource, including intellectual property rights. Recommended practice is to refer to a rights statement with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value (name, label, or short text) may be provided.

source.description:
A related resource from which the described resource is derived.
This property is intended to be used with non-literal values. The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a URI or a string conforming to a formal identification system.

spatial.description:
The geographical area covered by the dataset.
[CIM context: 
The responsibility area that multiple model can describe, also referred to frame.].

title.description: A name given to the resource.

type.description: The nature or genre of the resource. Recommended practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the DCMI Type Vocabulary [DCMI-TYPE]. To describe the file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource, use the property Format.

versionNotes.description: A description of changes between this version and the previous version of the resource.

DateTimeStamp.description: Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:dateTimeStamp, in which the time-zone field is mandatory.

endDate.description:
This property contains the end of the period.
[CIM context:
The end date and time of the validity period of the model that it is serialized in the document where the header is located. It is only used in relation to the startDate property which indicates the beginning of the validity period of the model.].

inSeries.description: A dataset series of which the dataset is part.

isVersionOf.description:
This resource has a more specific, versioned resource. This property is intended for relating a non-versioned or abstract resource to several versioned resources, e.g., snapshots.

The notion of version used by this property is limited to versions resulting from revisions occurring to a resource as part of its life-cycle. Therefore, its semantics is more specific than its super-property dcterms:hasVersion, which makes use of a broader notion of version, including editions and adaptations.

keyword.description:
A keyword or tag describing a resource.
[CIM context:
The intended content type of the model, usually the profile keyword. Used to identify what profiles and content is expected in the document, e.g., Equipment, Boundary, SSH, AE, etc. The same keyword is used for different versions of same profile. It can be also used to identify different content based on the same profile.
For instance, as the equipment profile can be used for both boundary data and equipment not related to boundary, the keyword is different to indicate that boundary data is exchanged. In order to avoid ambiguity the property is not exchanged in cases where the document contains multiple profiles referenced by dcterms:conformsTo.].

nextVersion.description: The next version for the resource.

previousVersion.description:
The previous version of a resource in a lineage.
This property is meant to be used to specify a version chain, consisting of snapshots of a resource.

The notion of version used by this property is limited to versions resulting from revisions occurring to a resource as part of its life-cycle. One of the typical cases here is representing the history of the versions of a dataset that have been released over time.

startDate.description:
This property contains the start of the period.
[CIM context:
The date and time that this model represents, i.e. for which the model is (or was) valid. It indicates the beginning of the validity period. It is indicating either an instant (in cases where the model is only valid for a point in time) or the start time of a period. If not provided the model is considered valid for any time stamp. The format is an extended format according to the ISO 8601-2005. European exchanges shall refer to UTC.].

Duration.description: Duration as "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS" which conforms to ISO 8601, where nY expresses a number of years, nM a number of months, nD a number of days. The letter T separates the date expression from the time expression and, after it, nH identifies a number of hours, nM a number of minutes and nS a number of seconds. The number of seconds could be expressed as a decimal number, but all other numbers are integers.

temporalResolution.description:
Minimum time period resolvable in a dataset.
[CIM context: 
Describes the Market Time Unit (MTU), e.g. hourly, 15 min., etc.]

Version.description: Datatype representing a version identifier that follows Semantic Versioning (SemVer 2.0.0) principles: MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH[-PRERELEASE][+BUILD]. The version consists of a sequence of numbers and optional alphanumeric identifiers that indicate changes in a system, model, or software over time.

version.description: The version indicator (name or identifier) of a resource.

generatedAtTime.description:
Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.
[CIM context:
The date and time when the model was serialized in the document where the header is located. The format is an extended format according to the ISO 8601-2005. European exchanges shall refer to UTC.].

wasGeneratedBy.description:
Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.
[CIM context:
Reference to an activity or the exact business nature (process, configuration) which produced or uses the model.].

applicationSoftware.description:
Identifies the application software which generated this instance file. The application software term is defined in ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017. The application software can be identified either:
- as a string which contains information on the software name and version, e.g. <tool_name>-<major_version>.<minor_version>.<patch>, or
- as a reference to a software identification tag as defined by ISO/IEC 19770-2:2015 and ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017.

processType.description: The exact business nature. Reference to Business Process configurations.

usedSettings.description: Reference to a set of parameters describing used settings (e.g. power flow settings, process settings, etc.) applied to the model prior its serialisation.

alternativeVersionOf.description:
This resource is an alternative version of a non-versioned or abstract resource.
This property is intended for relating a versioned resource to a non-versioned or abstract resource at the same time express that multiple versions exist.
dcatcim:alternativeVersionOf is a specialisation of dcat:isVersionOf with the restriction that the resource shall have a preferred version (dcatcim:preferredVersion) so that the preferred dataset can be used when there is no need to access all alternative versions.

preferredVersion.description:
The preferred version of a resource in a lineage of alternative versions.
This property is used to specify a specific version to be the preference in a chain of alternatives, consisting of snapshots of a resource.

DifferenceSet.description: A dataset that is represented by statement that describe the difference previous version by using forwardDifference Statement for item that is added and reverseDifference Statement for items that are removed. Items that are updated is described in both the forwardDifference and reversalDifference statements.

Statements.description: One or more facts in the form of an RDF triples that forms a cohesive description of change to a dataset.

forwardDifference.description: Statement that describes facts that has been added from previous version of the dataset.

reverseDifference.description: Statement that describes facts that has been removed from previous version of the dataset.

Statement.description: rdf:Statement is an instance of rdfs:Class. It is intended to represent the class of RDF statements. An RDF statement is the statement made by a token of an RDF triple. The subject of an RDF statement is the instance of rdfs:Resource identified by the subject of the triple. The predicate of an RDF statement is the instance of rdf:Property identified by the predicate of the triple. The object of an RDF statement is the instance of rdfs:Resource identified by the object of the triple. rdf:Statement is in the domain of the properties rdf:predicate, rdf:subject and rdf:object. Different individual rdf:Statement instances may have the same values for their rdf:predicate, rdf:subject and rdf:object properties.

statement.description: A name given to the resource.

ProfileMetadata.creator: ENTSO-E CIM WG NC project
ProfileMetadata.description: This vocabulary is describing the state instruction schedule profile.
ProfileMetadata.title: StateInstructionSchedule-AP-Voc-RDFS2020_v2-4-0.rdf
ProfileMetadata.comment: This package contains the state instruction schedule profile.
ProfileMetadata.label: StateInstructionScheduleProfile

String.description: A string consisting of a sequence of characters. The character encoding is UTF-8. The string length is unspecified and unlimited.

IdentifiedObject.description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

IdentifiedObject.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

IdentifiedObject.name.description: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

AssessedElementRegularSchedule.AssessedE.description: Assessed Element that has regular schedules.

BaseRegularIntervalSchedule.HourPattern.description: HourPattern that has base regular interval schedule.

BaseRegularIntervalSchedule.Season.description: Season associated with a base regular interval schedule.

DayOfWeekKind.bridgeDay.description: A day that is a gap between two distinguished days e.g holiday and weekend that leads to an abnormal scheduling behavior. e.g. if Ascension day falls on a Thursday, then Friday would be a bridge day due to the schedule will not have a normal Friday consumption and production.

DayOfWeekKind.friday.description: Friday as the day of the week.

DayOfWeekKind.monday.description: Monday as the day of the week.

DayOfWeekKind.publicHoliday.description: Public holiday is an officially designated day when most workplaces and schools are closed.

DayOfWeekKind.saturday.description: Saturday as the day of the week.

DayOfWeekKind.sunday.description: Sunday as the day of the week.

DayOfWeekKind.thursday.description: Thursday as the day of the week.

DayOfWeekKind.tuesday.description: Tuesday as the day of the week.

DayOfWeekKind.wednesday.description: Wednesday as the day of the week.

DayOfWeekKind.weekday.description: Day of the week other than Sunday or Saturday.

DayOfWeekKind.weekend.description: Day of the week which is Sunday or Saturday.

BaseRegularIntervalSchedule.dayOfWeek.description: Day of the week for which the schedule is valid for.

DateTime.description: Date and time as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sss", which conforms with ISO 8601. UTC time zone is specified as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ". A local timezone relative UTC is specified as "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sss-hh:mm". The second component (shown here as "ss.sss") could have any number of digits in its fractional part to allow any kind of precision beyond seconds.

BaseRegularIntervalSchedule.intervalEndT.description: Interval end time for which the schedule is valid for.

BaseRegularIntervalSchedule.intervalStar.description: Interval start time for which the schedule is valid for.

BaseTimeSeries.actionMethod.description: Action method used to create the value. This is used for identification in the case where there is multiple time series for the same validity period and kind.

TimeSeriesInterpolationKind.linear.description: Linear interpolation is applied for values between two time points.

TimeSeriesInterpolationKind.next.description: The value between two time points is set to next value.

TimeSeriesInterpolationKind.previous.description: The value between two time points is set to previous value.

BaseTimeSeries.interpolationKind.description: Kind of interpolation done between time point.

BaseTimeSeriesKind.actual.description: Time series is actual data. The values represent measured or calculated values that represent the actual behaviour.

BaseTimeSeriesKind.forecast.description: Time series is forecast data. The values represent the result of scientific predictions based on historical time stamped data.

BaseTimeSeriesKind.hindcast.description: Time series is hindcast data. The value represent probable past (historic) condition given by calculation done using actual values. For instance, determine the among of wind based on the energy produced by wind. However, hindcast is typical the result of a simulated forecasts for historical periods.

BaseTimeSeriesKind.schedule.description: Time series is schedule data. The values represent the result of a committed and plan forecast data that has been through a quality control and could incur penalty when not followed.

AssessedElementRegularTimePoint.description: Assessed element instruction value at a given point in time.

AssessedElementRegularTimePoint.Assessed.description: Assessed element regular schedule which has assessed element regular time points.

PerCent.description: Percentage on a defined base.   For example, specify as 100 to indicate at the defined base.

AssessedElementRegularTimePoint.appointe.description:
The percentage (appointed to a region) of the remaining margin obtained in the grid model to reach its current limit. The maximum percentage shall by default be 10% of the remaining margin.
It is only used when an assessed element is considered conservative for a region.
The allowed value range is [0,100].

Boolean.description: A type with the value space "true" and "false".

AssessedElementRegularTimePoint.enabled.description: It identifies if the assessed element is enabled. True means enabled, False means disabled.

ActivePower.description: Product of RMS value of the voltage and the RMS value of the in-phase component of the current.

AssessedElementRegularTimePoint.maxFlow.description: Maximum flow on an a conducting equipment or a collection of conducting equipment forming a power transfer corridor. For assessed elements that is becomes critical due to contingency, this value represents the maximum flow with remedial action taken into consideration.

AssessedElementRegularTimePoint.positive.description:
A margin defined only for scanned AssessedElement (If AssessedElement.ScannedForRegion is present) in order to represent the influence of available remedial action which is not cross-border relevant remedial action.
The margin is modifying the limits used for the assessment whatever the limit it is (e.g. PATL, TATL).This symbolizes a remedial action that can be applied internally by the System Operator. It will be resolved by the System Operator and not by the optimization of remedial actions. The attribute shall be a positive value.
The allowed value range is [0,100].

AssessedElementRegularTimePoint.scannedT.description:
Threshold percentage that a scanned element can be overloaded, on a given element, on top of any overload prior to optimisation (default= 5%). e.g. Initial loading of the element is 110%, with a 5% scanned threshold margin, the new maximum is 115% of the limit (e.g. PATL, TATL, etc).
The allowed value range is [0,100].

AssessedElementSchedule.AssessedElement.description: Assessed element which has an assessed element schedule.

AssessedElementTimePoint.description: Assessed element instruction value at a given point in time.

AssessedElementTimePoint.AssessedElement.description: The assessed element schedule that has this time point.

AssessedElementTimePoint.appointedMargin.description:
The percentage (appointed to a region) of the remaining margin obtained in the grid model to reach its current limit. The maximum percentage shall by default be 10% of the remaining margin.
It is only used when an assessed element is considered conservative for a region.
The allowed value range is [0,100].

AssessedElementTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

AssessedElementTimePoint.coordinatedVali.description: A positive value expressed in MW, calculated and provided by the coordinated capacity calculator (CCC) for the reduction of Remaining Available Margin (RAM) in order to ensure grid security.

A text description provided by the coordinated capacity calculator (CCC) for justifying the reduction of Remaining Available Margin (RAM) by means of Coordinated Validation Adjustment (CVA). This justification is not intended for any application processing purpose, it should only be used for reporting.

AssessedElementTimePoint.criticalElement.description: Justification indicating the kind of critical element. This justification is not intended for any application processing purpose, it should only be used for reporting.

AssessedElementTimePoint.enabled.description: It identifies if the assessed element is enabled. True means enabled, False means disabled.

SecuredExclusionReasonKind.capacityCalcu.description: The network element that is going to be assessed is excluded for being secured by the capacity calculation region.

SecuredExclusionReasonKind.nonNativeCapa.description: The network element that is going to be assessed is excluded for being secured for the native capacity calculation region since it would be secured for a non native capacity calculation region.

SecuredExclusionReasonKind.systemOperato.description: The network element that is going to be assessed is excluded for being secured by the system operator.

AssessedElementTimePoint.exclusionReason.description: Reason for not associating this assessed element with a secured region.

AssessedElementTimePoint.individualValid.description: A positive value expressed in MW, calculated and provided by System Operators from their individual validation process for the reduction of Remaining Available Margin in order to ensure grid security.

A text description provided by System Operators for justifying the reduction of Remaining Available Margin (RAM) by means of Individual Validation Adjustment (IVA). This justification is not intended for any application processing purpose, it should only be used for reporting.

A positive value expressed in MW, calculated by the coordinated capacity calculator (CCC) based on the provided Individual Validation Adjustment (IVA) by System Operators in order to show the actual reduction of Remaining Available Margin (RAM). Individual Validation Adjustment Share is a positive non-zero value. It is equal or less than the Individual Validation Adjustment value.

AssessedElementTimePoint.maxFlow.description: Maximum flow on an a conducting equipment or a collection of conducting equipment forming a power transfer corridor. For assessed elements that is becomes critical due to contingency, this value represents the maximum flow with remedial action taken into consideration.

AssessedElementTimePoint.positiveVirtual.description:
A margin defined only for scanned AssessedElement (If AssessedElement.ScannedForRegion is present) in order to represent the influence of available remedial action which is not cross-border relevant remedial action.
The margin is modifying the limits used for the assessment whatever the limit it is (e.g. PATL, TATL).This symbolizes a remedial action that can be applied internally by the System Operator. It will be resolved by the System Operator and not by the optimization of remedial actions. The attribute shall be a positive value.
The allowed value range is [0,100].

AssessedElementTimePoint.scannedThreshol.description:
Threshold percentage that a scanned element can be overloaded, on a given element, on top of any overload prior to optimisation (default= 5%). e.g. Initial loading of the element is 110%, with a 5% scanned threshold margin, the new maximum is 115% of the limit (e.g. PATL, TATL, etc).
The allowed value range is [0,100].

AssessedElementTimePoint.targetRemaining.description: Justification indicating the target remaining available margin. This justification is not intended for any application processing purpose, it should only be used for reporting.

AvailabilityTimePoint.description: Availability instruction value at a given point in time.

AvailabilityTimePoint.GenericAvailabilit.description: The availability schedule which belongs to the availability timepoint.

AvailabilityTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

AvailabilityTimePoint.available.description: It identifies if the element is available. True means available, False means unavailable.

BaseCaseCurrentLimitSchedule.description: The schedule for a base case current limit.

BaseCaseCurrentLimitSchedule.BaseCaseCur.description: Base case current limit which has base case current limit schedule.

BaseCaseCurrentLimitTimePoint.description: Base case current limit at a given point in time.

BaseCaseCurrentLimitTimePoint.BaseCaseCu.description: Base case current limit schedule that has time point.

BaseCaseCurrentLimitTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

CurrentFlow.description: Electrical current with sign convention: positive flow is out of the conducting equipment into the connectivity node. Can be both AC and DC.

BaseCaseCurrentLimitTimePoint.value.description: Value of current limit. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

ContingencySchedule.Contingency.description: Contingency which has a contingency schedule.

ContingencyTimePoint.description: Contingency instruction value at a given point in time.

ContingencyTimePoint.ContingencySchedule.description: The contingency schedule that has this time point.

ContingencyTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

ContingencyTimePoint.mustStudy.description: Set true if must study this contingency.

ContingencyTimePoint.probability.description: Probability of occurrence. The allowed value range is [0,100].

EnablingTimePoint.description: Enabling instruction value at a given point in time.

EnablingTimePoint.GenericEnablingSchedul.description: The enabling schedule which belongs to the enabling timepoint.

EnablingTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

EnablingTimePoint.enabled.description: It identifies if the element is enabled. True means enabled, False means not enabled.

FuelStorageSchedule.FuelStorage.description: Fuel storgae of this fuel storage schedule.

FuelStorageTimePoint.description: Fuel storage values for a given point in time.

FuelStorageTimePoint.FuelStorageSchedule.description: The fuel storage schedule that has this time point.

FuelStorageTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

FuelStorageTimePoint.energyStorage.description: Amount of energy available in the storage.

GenericAvailableSchedule.description: The schedule for the availability of elements.

GenericAvailableSchedule.RemedialAction.description: Remedial action which has available schedules.

GenericEnablingSchedule.description: The schedule for the enabling of elements.

GenericEnablingSchedule.AssessedElementW.description: Assessed element with contingency that has enabling schedules.
Assessed element with remedial action that has enabling schedules.

GenericEnablingSchedule.AutomationFuncti.description: Automation function which has enabling schedules.

GenericEnablingSchedule.ContingencyWithR.description: Contingency with remedial action which has enabling schedules.

GenericEnablingSchedule.CrossBorderRelev.description: Cross border relevant that has enabling schedules.

GenericEnablingSchedule.FunctionBlock.description: Function block which has enabling schedules.

GenericEnablingSchedule.PowerTransferCor.description: Power transfer corridor which has generic enabling schedules.

GenericEnablingSchedule.RemedialActionDe.description: Remedial action dependency which has enabling schedules.

GenericSequenceSchedule.EnergyBlockOrder.description: Energy block order which has generic sequence schedules.

GenericValueSchedule.description: Time series represent irregular generic value at given points in time. The type of value is given by the reference association.

GenericValueSchedule.RangeConstraint.description: Range constraint for the generic value schedule.

GenericValueTimePoint.description: Generic value for a given point in time.

GenericValueTimePoint.GenericValueSchedu.description: Time series the time point values belongs to.

GenericValueTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

Float.description: A floating point number. The range is unspecified and not limited.

GenericValueTimePoint.value.description: The value at the time. The meaning of the value is defined by the derived type of the associated schedule. The value can be integer, float or boolean. In case of boolean 1 equals true and 0 equals false.

GridStateAlterationSchedule.description: Schedule for a grid state alteration.

GridStateAlterationSchedule.GridStateAlt.description: Grid state alteration which has grid state alteration schedules.

GridStateAlterationTimePoint.description: Grid state alteration at a given point in time.

GridStateAlterationTimePoint.GridStateAl.description: Grid state alteration schedule that has time point.

GridStateAlterationTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

GridStateAlterationTimePoint.enabled.description: The status of the GridStateAlteration set by an operation or by a signal resulting from a control action.

GridStateAlterationTimePoint.participati.description:
Participation factor describing the entity part of the active power provided by a collection of entities (e.g. an active power forecast to a collection of entities is divided to each of the member entity according to the participation factor). Must be a positive value.
In the case of a sharing strategy, the distribution is following entities value (V) equals aggregated value (T) divided by sum of participation factors (PF), i.e. V=T/sum(PF). 
In the case of priority strategy, the item with the lowest number gets allocated energy first.
e.g. If 0 this grid alteration does not participate. The sum of all participation factors for all grid state alterations associated with same remedial action shall be equal to 100%.

GridStateIntensitySchedule.description: Defines the intensity applied for a given grid state alteration. It is primarily used in exchanges related to the remedial action schedule. The value provided by the schedule replaces the value of the attribute to which the schedule refers to.

ValueOffsetKind.absolute.description: Value of the range constraint is replacing the attribute value referenced by the PropertyReference in a determined operational scenario.

ValueOffsetKind.incremental.description: Value of the range constraint is incrementing the attribute value referenced by the PropertyReference in a determined operational scenario.

ValueOffsetKind.incrementalPercentage.description: Value of the range constraint is incrementing in percentage the attribute value referenced by the PropertyReference in a determined operational scenario.

GridStateIntensitySchedule.valueKind.description: The kind of value1 and value2 of the associated IrregularIntervalSchedule.

HourPattern.description: Pattern of hourly period in a day with the same kind of intensity.

EnergyScenarioKind.consumption.description: Scenario focus on consumption of energy.

EnergyScenarioKind.export.description: Scenario focus on export of energy.

EnergyScenarioKind.import.description: Scenario focus on import of energy.

EnergyScenarioKind.production.description: Scenario focus on production of energy.

EnergyScenarioKind.storage.description: Scenario focus on storage of energy.

HourPattern.energyDemandKind.description: Type of energy demand that the pattern is valid for.

PeakKind.offPeak.description: Off-peak refer to periods of lower demand for a particular service or commodity.

PeakKind.onPeak.description: Off-peak refer to periods of higher demand for a particular service or commodity.

HourPattern.peakKind.description: Type of peak or intensity that the pattern is valid for.

HourPeriod.description: Period of hours in a day.

HourPeriod.HourPattern.description: HourPattern which has some hour periods.

Time.description: Time as "hh:mm:ss.sss", which conforms with ISO 8601. UTC time zone is specified as "hh:mm:ss.sssZ". A local timezone relative UTC is specified as "hh:mm:ss.sss±hh:mm". The second component (shown here as "ss.sss") could have any number of digits in its fractional part to allow any kind of precision beyond seconds.

HourPeriod.endTime.description: Time the period end and not including, e.g. 13:00 which means it does not include the time of 13:00 but 12:59.

HourPeriod.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

HourPeriod.startTime.description: Time the period start and including, e.g. 12:00 which means it include the time of 12:00.

InfeedLimitSchedule.description: The schedule for an infeed limit.

InfeedLimitSchedule.InfeedLimit.description: Infeed limit which has infeed limit schedule.

InfeedLimitTimePoint.description: Infeed limit at a given point in time.

InfeedLimitTimePoint.InfeedLimitSchedule.description: Infeed limit schedule that has time point.

InfeedLimitTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

InfeedLimitTimePoint.valueA.description: Value of current limit. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

InfeedLimitTimePoint.valueW.description: Value of active power limit. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

ParticipationFactorTimePoint.description: Participation factor for a given point in time.

ParticipationFactorTimePoint.PowerShiftK.description: The Power Shift Key schedule which belongs to the participation factor timepoint.

ParticipationFactorTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

ParticipationFactorTimePoint.participati.description:
Participation factor describing the entity part of the active power provided by a collection of entities (e.g. an active power forecast to a collection of entities is divided to each of the member entity according to the participation factor). Must be a positive value.
In the case of a sharing strategy, the distribution is following entities value (V) equals aggregated value (T) divided by sum of participation factors (PF), i.e. V=T/sum(PF). 
In the case of priority strategy, the item with the lowest number gets allocated energy first.

PowerBidDependency.description: Dependency between the related power bids.

PowerBidDependency.DependeePowerBidSched.description: The dependee (parent) power bid schedule for this dependency.

PowerBidDependency.DependentPowerBidSche.description: The dependent (child) power bid schedule for this dependency.

Duration.description: Duration as "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS" which conforms to ISO 8601, where nY expresses a number of years, nM a number of months, nD a number of days. The letter T separates the date expression from the time expression and, after it, nH identifies a number of hours, nM a number of minutes and nS a number of seconds. The number of seconds could be expressed as a decimal number, but all other numbers are integers.

PowerBidDependency.finishToFinishLag.description:
Time between the deactivation of the dependee (parent) bids and the deactivation of dependent (child) bids. It cannot be used when the PowerBidDependency.kind is set to exclusive. Depending on the finishToFinishLagKind the value has the following meaning:
  • exact: the indicated lag should be exactly respected.
  • minimum: the indicated lag should be the minimum respected one, and a greater or equal lag for the deactivation of the dependent (child) after the deactivation of the dependee (parent) is allowed.
  • maximum: the indicated lag is the maximum that can occur, and a less or equal lag for the deactivation of the dependent (child) after the deactivation of the dependee (parent) is allowed.

PowerBidDependency.finishToFinishLagKind.description: It indicates the finishToFinishLag kind between the deactivation of the dependee (parent) bids and the deactivation of dependent (child) bids. It is required if PowerBidDependency.finishToFinishLag is used.

PowerBidDependency.finishToStartLag.description:
Time between the deactivation of the dependee (parent) bids and the activation of dependent (child) bids. It cannot be used when the PowerBidDependency.kind is set to exclusive. Depending on the finishToStartLagKind the value has the following meaning:
  • exact: the indicated lag should be exactly respected.
  • minimum: the indicated lag should be the minimum respected one, and a greater or equal lag for the activation of the dependent (child) after the deactivation of the dependee (parent) is allowed.
  • maximum: the indicated lag is the maximum that can occur, and a less or equal lag for the activation of the dependent (child) after the deactivation of the dependee (parent) is allowed.

PowerBidDependency.finishToStartLagKind.description: It indicates the finishToStartLag kind between the deactivation of the dependee (parent) bids and the activation of dependent (child) bids. It is required if PowerBidDependency.finishToStartLag is used.

PowerBidDependencyKind.exclusive.description: Bids are exclusive depending on each other. Only dependee (parent) bids can be activated if dependent (child) is activated or vice versa. For instance, dependent (child) must not be activated if the dependee (parent) is activated.

PowerBidDependencyKind.inclusive.description: Bids are inclusive depending on each other. Both dependee (parent) and dependent (child) bids must be activated, i.e., dependent (child) must be activated if the dependee (parent) is activated.

PowerBidDependencyKind.restrictive.description: Bids are restrictive depending on each other. The activation of dependent (child) bids is optional if the dependee (parent) is activated.

PowerBidDependency.kind.description:
Type of dependency between bids. It indicates the activation dependency between dependee (parent) and dependent (child) bids. It does not indicate any running condition between dependee and dependent bids.
If PowerBidDependencyKind equals to restrictive, a combination of the following attributes PowerBidDependency.startToStartLag, PowerBidDependency.finishToStartLag, PowerBidDependency.finishToFinishLag, or PowerBidDependency.overlap shall be used.

PowerBidDependency.mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

PowerBidDependency.overlap.description:
It indicates the duration the dependee (parent) and dependent (child) bids are active (run) at the same time. It cannot be used when the PowerBidDependency.kind is set to exclusive. Depending on the overlapKind the value has the following meaning:
  • exact: the dependee (parent) and the dependent (child) should be active (running) for the exact (equal) specified duration.
  • minimum: the dependee (parent) and the dependent (child) should be active (running) at least (greater than or equal) for the specified duration.
  • maximum: the dependee (parent) and the dependent (child) should be active (running) at the most (less than or equal) for the specified duration.

PowerBidDependency.overlapKind.description: It indicates the overlap kind for the duration the parent (dependee) and child (dependent) bids are active at the same time. It is required when PowerBidDependency.overlap is used.

PowerBidDependency.startToStartLag.description:
Time between the activation of dependee (parent) bids and the activation of dependent (child) bids. It cannot be used when the PowerBidDependency.kind is set to exclusive. Depending on the startToStartLagKind the value has the following meaning:
    • exact - the indicated lag should be exactly respected.
    • minimum - the indicated lag should be the minimum respected one and a higher or equal lag for the activation of the dependent (child) after the activation of the dependee (parent) is allowed.
    • maximum - the indicated lag is the maximum that can occur, and a smaller or equal lag for the activation of the dependent (child) after the activation of the dependee (parent)is allowed.

PowerBidDependency.startToStartLagKind.description: Indicates the startToStartLag kind between the activation of the dependee (parent) bid and the activation of dependent (child) bid. It is required if PowerBidDependency.startToStartLag is used.

PowerBidSchedule.description: Power bid or offer related to a redispatch or countertrading measures. In the case of market place for economic efficiency of the bids and offers, this is equivalent to BidTimeSeries class in 62325 package.

PowerBidSchedule.PowerRemedialAction.description: Power remedial action for which the bid is given.

PowerBidSchedule.ScheduleResource.description: Schedule resource which has several power bid schedules.

Decimal.description: Decimal is the base-10 notational system for representing real numbers.

Currency.BMD.description: Bermudian dollar (customarily known as Bermuda dollar).

BidDirectionKind.down.description: Down signifies that the available power can be used by the purchasing area to decrease energy.

BidDirectionKind.stable.description: The direction at a given instant in time is considered to be stable.

BidDirectionKind.up.description: Up signifies that the available power can be used by the purchasing area to increase energy.

BidDirectionKind.upAndDown.description: Up and down signifies that both up and down values are equal.

PowerBidSchedule.direction.description: Define the direction of the energy adjustment.

PowerBidSchedule.isFixed.description: Indicates if the power bid schedule is fixed, meaning that all the different power bid schedule values need to be taken without changes. e.g. It is a take-it-or-leave-it bid offer.

PowerBidSchedule.isOffer.description: Indicates if the power bid is an offer or not. True, means that the bid is an offer. False, means that the bid is not an offer.

PowerBidSchedule.leadTime.description: Time it takes for the bid to be called upon until it is active.

PowerBidSchedule.maxRampDownP.description: Maximum decrease of the active power change from one time point to the next.

PowerBidSchedule.maxRampUpP.description: Maximum increase of the active power change from one time point to the next.

PowerBidSchedule.maximumUptime.description: Maximum duration the action needs to be remain active after startup.

PowerBidSchedule.minimumOffTime.description: Minimum time interval between activation of the bid involving startup and shutdown. This value overrides any value on the unit.

PowerBidSchedule.minimumUptime.description: Minimum duration the action needs to be remain active after startup.

Integer.description: An integer number. The range is unspecified and not limited.

PowerBidSchedule.priority.description: The numeric local priority given to a bid. Lower numeric values will have higher priority.

PowerBidSchedule.shutdownCost.description: Total shutdown cost incurred for all the units involved in the bid. This overrides any cost on the specific unit.

PowerBidSchedule.totalMaximumEnergy.description: Maximum total energy that can be activated by the bid.

PowerBidSchedule.totalMinimumEnergy.description: Minimum total energy that has to be activated by the bid.

PowerBidScheduleTimePoint.description: Time series represent irregular power, active and reactive, values at given points in time.

PowerBidScheduleTimePoint.PowerBidSchedu.description: Power bid schedule that has many power bid schedule time points.

PowerBidScheduleTimePoint.activationCost.description: Cost to activate the bid in the given time point.

PowerBidScheduleTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

PowerBidScheduleTimePoint.minimumActivat.description: Minimum active power given in the time point.

PowerBidScheduleTimePoint.p.description: Active power given in the time point.

PowerBidScheduleTimePoint.price.description: Price given in the time point.

PowerBidScheduleTimePoint.reservePrice.description: Price for reserving the step increment active power.

PowerBidScheduleTimePoint.shutdownCost.description: Total shutdown cost incurred for all the units involved in the bid given in the time point. This overrides any cost on the specific unit.

PowerBidScheduleTimePoint.stepIncrementP.description: The minimum increment that can be applied for an increase in an activation request.

PowerRemedialActionSchedule.description: The schedule for a power remedial action.

PowerRemedialActionSchedule.PowerRemedia.description: Power remedial action for the power remedial action schedule.

PowerRemedialActionTimePoint.description: Regulating values at a given point in time.

PowerRemedialActionTimePoint.PowerRemedi.description: The power remedial action schedule that has this time point.

PowerRemedialActionTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

PowerRemedialActionTimePoint.maxRegulati.description: Maximum net amount of active power that the remedial action can regulate down.
Maximum net amount of active power that the remedial action can regulate up.

PowerShiftKeyDistribution.description: Distribution of the bid action on the power shift keys.

PowerShiftKeyDistribution.PowerBidSchedu.description: Power bid schedule for the given distribution.

PowerShiftKeyDistribution.PowerShiftKeyS.description: Power Shift Key schedule in power shift key distribution.
Power Shift Key Strategy which has a Power Shift Key Distribution.

PowerShiftKeySchedule.description: The schedule for Power Shift Keys.

PowerShiftKeySchedule.DCPole.description: A DC Pole which has a Power Shift Key Schedule.

PowerShiftKeySchedule.EnergyBlockOrder.description: An energy block order which has a Power Shift Key Schedule.

PowerShiftKeySchedule.EnergyConsumer.description: The EnergyConsumer that has a Power Shift Key schedule.

PowerShiftKeySchedule.EnergyGroup.description: The energy group which has a Power Shift Key Schedule.

PowerShiftKeySchedule.EnergySource.description: The energy source which has a power shift key schedule. The renewable resources should be modelled as PowerElecronicsUnit.

PowerShiftKeySchedule.EquivalentInjectio.description: Equivalent injection which is part of a powoer shift key schedule.

PowerShiftKeySchedule.ExternalNetworkInj.description: The energy source which has a power shift key schedule.

PowerShiftKeySchedule.GeneratingUnit.description: The Generating Unit which has a Power Shift Key Schedule.

PowerShiftKeySchedule.HydroPump.description: The Hydro Pump which has a Power Shift Key schedule.

PowerShiftKeySchedule.PowerElectronicsUn.description: The Power Electronics Unit which has a  Power Shift Key schedule.

PowerShiftKeySchedule.ScheduleResource.description: The Schedule Resource which has a  Power Shift Key schedule.

RemedialActionGroupSchedule.description: The schedule for a remedial action group.

RemedialActionGroupSchedule.RemedialActi.description: Remedial action group which has remedial action group schedules.

RemedialActionGroupTimePoint.description: Remedial action group at a given point in time.

RemedialActionGroupTimePoint.RemedialAct.description: Remedial action group schedule that has time point.

RemedialActionGroupTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

RemedialActionGroupTimePoint.maxRegulati.description: Maximum net amount of active power that the group of remedial actions can regulate down.
Maximum net amount of active power that the group of remedial actions can regulate up.

RemedialActionSchemeSchedule.description: The schedule for a remedial action scheme.

RemedialActionSchemeSchedule.ArmedRemedi.description: Armed remedial action for a remedial action scheme.

RemedialActionSchemeTimePoint.description: Remedial action scheme at a given point in time.

RemedialActionSchemeTimePoint.RemedialAc.description: Remedial action scheme schedule that has time point.

RemedialActionSchemeTimePoint.armed.description: Defines the arming status of the remedial action scheme. It is set by operation or by signal.

RemedialActionSchemeTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

RemedialActionSchemeTimePoint.inService.description: Specifies the availability of the Remedial Action Scheme (RAS). If true, the RAS is available for contingency processing. If false, the RAS is treated by contingency processing as if it is not in the model.

ReservoirSchedule.Reservoir.description: The reservoir that has a schedule.

ReservoirTimePoint.description: Reservoir values for a given point in time.

ReservoirTimePoint.ReservoirSchedule.description: The reservoir schedule that has this time point.

ReservoirTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

ReservoirTimePoint.energyStorage.description: Amount of energy available in the storage.

Season.description: A specified time period of the year.

MonthDay.description: MonthDay format as "--mm-dd", which conforms with XSD data type gMonthDay.

SequenceTimePoint.description: Sequence at a given point in time.

SequenceTimePoint.GenericSequenceSchedul.description: The sequence schedule which belongs to the sequence timepoint.

SequenceTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

SequenceTimePoint.sequence.description: Sequence needs to be ordered by the scheduling area. It has to be unique by the scheduling area.

StageTriggerSchedule.StageTrigger.description: Stage trigger which has stage trigger schedules.

StageTriggerTimePoint.description: Stage trigger values at a given point in time.

StageTriggerTimePoint.StageTriggerSchedu.description: Stage trigger schedule that has time point.

StageTriggerTimePoint.armed.description: Defines the arming status of the remedial action scheme. It is set by operation or by signal.

StageTriggerTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

StageTriggerTimePoint.inService.description: Specifies the availability of the Remedial Action Scheme (RAS). If true, the RAS is available for contingency processing. If false, the RAS is treated by contingency processing as if it is not in the model.

UnitCostSchedule.description: The schedule for a unit cost.

UnitCostSchedule.GeneratingUnit.description: GeneratingUnit which has unit cost schedules.

UnitCostSchedule.currency.description: Currency the energy price is given in.

UnitCostTimePoint.description: Unit cost at a given point in time.

UnitCostTimePoint.UnitCostSchedule.description: The unit cost schedule that has time point.

UnitCostTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

UnitCostTimePoint.shutdownCost.description: The shutdown cost incurred for each shutdown of the GeneratingUnit.

UnitCostTimePoint.startupCost.description: The initial startup cost incurred for each start of the GeneratingUnit.

UnitCostTimePoint.warmStartupCost.description: The warm startup cost incurred for each start of the GeneratingUnit.

VoltageAngleSchedule.description: The schedule for a voltage angle.

VoltageAngleSchedule.VoltageAngleLimit.description: Voltage angle limit which has voltage angle schedule.

VoltageAngleTimePoint.description: Voltage angle at a given point in time.

VoltageAngleTimePoint.VoltageAngleSchedu.description: The voltage angle schedule that has time point.

VoltageAngleTimePoint.atTime.description: The time the data is valid for.

VoltageAngleTimePoint.value.description: The difference in angle degrees between referenced by the association end OperationalLimitSet.Terminal and the Terminal referenced by the association end VoltageAngleLimit.AngleReferenceTerminal. The value shall be positive (greater than zero).

Dataset.description: A collection of data, published or curated by a single source, and available for access or download in one or more representations.

URI.description: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) or URI Reference as defined by [RFC 3986], including amendments from [RFC 6874] for IPv6 zone identifiers. The value may be absolute or relative and can include an optional fragment identifier. This datatype is used to indicate that the value fulfills the role of a URI or URI Reference, providing a consistent format for referencing abstract or physical resources.

accessRights.description:
Information about who access the resource or an indication of its security status. Access Rights may include information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies.
[CIM context:
Reference to the confidentiality level that shall be applied when handling this model.].

accrualPeriodicity.description:
The frequency with which items are added to a collection.
[CIM context:
Reference to the time frame.].

conformsTo.description:
An established standard to which the described resource conforms.
[CIM context:
An IRI describing the profile that governs this model. It uniquely identifies the profile and its version. Multiple instances of the property describe all standards or specifications to which the model and the document representing this model conform to.
A document would normally conform to profile definitions, the constraints that relate to the profile and/or the set of business specific constrains. A reference to a machine- readable constraints or specification indicates that the document was tested against these constraints and it conforms to them.].

LangString.description: Datatype that conforms to rdf:langString, representing a textual value with an associated language tag, following BCP 47 language conventions (e.g., en, fr-CA, no-NB).

description.description:
A free-text account of the resource.
Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, a table of contents, a graphical representation, or a free-text account of the resource.

hasPart.description: The dataset which is part of another dataset.

UUID.description: Datatype representing a unique identifier in the form of a universally unique identifier (UUID). The value must conform to the UUID format as defined in RFC 4122, allowing for globally unique identification of entities.

identifier.description:
A unique identifier of the resource being described or cataloged.
The identifier might be used as part of the IRI of the resource, but still having it represented explicitly is useful.
The identifier is a text string which is assigned to the resource to provide an unambiguous reference within a particular context.
[CIM context:
A unique identifier of the model which is serialised in the document where the header is located. The identifier is persistent for a given version of the model and shall change when the model changes.
If a model is serialized as complete (full) model or as difference model exchange the identifier shall be the same. The identifier shall not be used as an identifier of the document which can be different for a given version of a model.].

issued.description:
Date of formal issuance of the resource.
Recommended practice is to describe the date, date/time, or period of time as recommended for the property Date, of which this is a subproperty.
[CIM context:
Reference to the date that the complete data set was made valid/available.].

license.description:
A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource. Recommended practice is to identify the license document with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value that identifies the license may be provided.
[CIM context:
Reference to the license under which the data is made available. If no license holder is defined, then the original data provider holds the license.].

publisher.description:
An entity responsible for making the resource available.
[CIM context: 
The agent that is publishing the dataset on the given platform.]

references.description:
A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise pointed to by the described resource[.
[CIM context: 
The referenced resource that is being complemented in this dataset, e.g. SSH is referencing EQ.]

replaces.description:
A related resource that is supplanted, displaced, or superseded by the described resource
[CIM context: 
The referenced dataset is being replaced by this dataset.]

requires.description: A related resource that is required by the described resource to support its function, delivery, or coherence.

rights.description: A statement that concerns all rights not addressed with dct:license or dct:accessRights, such as copyright statements.

rightsHolder.description:
Information about rights held in and over the resource.
Typically, rights information includes a statement about various property rights associated with the resource, including intellectual property rights. Recommended practice is to refer to a rights statement with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value (name, label, or short text) may be provided.

source.description:
A related resource from which the described resource is derived.
This property is intended to be used with non-literal values. The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a URI or a string conforming to a formal identification system.

spatial.description:
The geographical area covered by the dataset.
[CIM context: 
The responsibility area that multiple model can describe, also referred to frame.].

title.description: A name given to the resource.

type.description: The nature or genre of the resource. Recommended practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the DCMI Type Vocabulary [DCMI-TYPE]. To describe the file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource, use the property Format.

versionNotes.description: A description of changes between this version and the previous version of the resource.

DateTimeStamp.description: Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:dateTimeStamp, in which the time-zone field is mandatory.

endDate.description:
This property contains the end of the period.
[CIM context:
The end date and time of the validity period of the model that it is serialized in the document where the header is located. It is only used in relation to the startDate property which indicates the beginning of the validity period of the model.].

inSeries.description: A dataset series of which the dataset is part.

isVersionOf.description:
This resource has a more specific, versioned resource. This property is intended for relating a non-versioned or abstract resource to several versioned resources, e.g., snapshots.

The notion of version used by this property is limited to versions resulting from revisions occurring to a resource as part of its life-cycle. Therefore, its semantics is more specific than its super-property dcterms:hasVersion, which makes use of a broader notion of version, including editions and adaptations.

keyword.description:
A keyword or tag describing a resource.
[CIM context:
The intended content type of the model, usually the profile keyword. Used to identify what profiles and content is expected in the document, e.g., Equipment, Boundary, SSH, AE, etc. The same keyword is used for different versions of same profile. It can be also used to identify different content based on the same profile.
For instance, as the equipment profile can be used for both boundary data and equipment not related to boundary, the keyword is different to indicate that boundary data is exchanged. In order to avoid ambiguity the property is not exchanged in cases where the document contains multiple profiles referenced by dcterms:conformsTo.].

nextVersion.description: The next version for the resource.

previousVersion.description:
The previous version of a resource in a lineage.
This property is meant to be used to specify a version chain, consisting of snapshots of a resource.

The notion of version used by this property is limited to versions resulting from revisions occurring to a resource as part of its life-cycle. One of the typical cases here is representing the history of the versions of a dataset that have been released over time.

startDate.description:
This property contains the start of the period.
[CIM context:
The date and time that this model represents, i.e. for which the model is (or was) valid. It indicates the beginning of the validity period. It is indicating either an instant (in cases where the model is only valid for a point in time) or the start time of a period. If not provided the model is considered valid for any time stamp. The format is an extended format according to the ISO 8601-2005. European exchanges shall refer to UTC.].

temporalResolution.description:
Minimum time period resolvable in a dataset.
[CIM context: 
Describes the Market Time Unit (MTU), e.g. hourly, 15 min., etc.]

Version.description: Datatype representing a version identifier that follows Semantic Versioning (SemVer 2.0.0) principles: MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH[-PRERELEASE][+BUILD]. The version consists of a sequence of numbers and optional alphanumeric identifiers that indicate changes in a system, model, or software over time.

version.description: The version indicator (name or identifier) of a resource.

generatedAtTime.description:
Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.
[CIM context:
The date and time when the model was serialized in the document where the header is located. The format is an extended format according to the ISO 8601-2005. European exchanges shall refer to UTC.].

wasGeneratedBy.description:
Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.
[CIM context:
Reference to an activity or the exact business nature (process, configuration) which produced or uses the model.].

applicationSoftware.description:
Identifies the application software which generated this instance file. The application software term is defined in ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017. The application software can be identified either:
- as a string which contains information on the software name and version, e.g. <tool_name>-<major_version>.<minor_version>.<patch>, or
- as a reference to a software identification tag as defined by ISO/IEC 19770-2:2015 and ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765:2017.

processType.description: The exact business nature. Reference to Business Process configurations.

usedSettings.description: Reference to a set of parameters describing used settings (e.g. power flow settings, process settings, etc.) applied to the model prior its serialisation.

alternativeVersionOf.description:
This resource is an alternative version of a non-versioned or abstract resource.
This property is intended for relating a versioned resource to a non-versioned or abstract resource at the same time express that multiple versions exist.
dcatcim:alternativeVersionOf is a specialisation of dcat:isVersionOf with the restriction that the resource shall have a preferred version (dcatcim:preferredVersion) so that the preferred dataset can be used when there is no need to access all alternative versions.

preferredVersion.description:
The preferred version of a resource in a lineage of alternative versions.
This property is used to specify a specific version to be the preference in a chain of alternatives, consisting of snapshots of a resource.

DifferenceSet.description: A dataset that is represented by statement that describe the difference previous version by using forwardDifference Statement for item that is added and reverseDifference Statement for items that are removed. Items that are updated is described in both the forwardDifference and reversalDifference statements.

Statements.description: One or more facts in the form of an RDF triples that forms a cohesive description of change to a dataset.

forwardDifference.description: Statement that describes facts that has been added from previous version of the dataset.

reverseDifference.description: Statement that describes facts that has been removed from previous version of the dataset.

Statement.description: rdf:Statement is an instance of rdfs:Class. It is intended to represent the class of RDF statements. An RDF statement is the statement made by a token of an RDF triple. The subject of an RDF statement is the instance of rdfs:Resource identified by the subject of the triple. The predicate of an RDF statement is the instance of rdf:Property identified by the predicate of the triple. The object of an RDF statement is the instance of rdfs:Resource identified by the object of the triple. rdf:Statement is in the domain of the properties rdf:predicate, rdf:subject and rdf:object. Different individual rdf:Statement instances may have the same values for their rdf:predicate, rdf:subject and rdf:object properties.

statement.description: A name given to the resource.

ProfileMetadata.creator: ENTSO-E CIM WG NC project
ProfileMetadata.description: This vocabulary is describing the monitoring area profile.
